Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de ses enfants en augmentant leurs conditions de vie
texts.en:
This group has been created in January 2004 and is composed of women who have experience with the loan program. They mainly work as vendors. Ms. Salimatou (the one seated on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has three sons and two daughters. She sells fritters. 

With this new loan,  Salimatou plans to buy one bag of flour at 19,000 West African francs per week, four bags of sugar at 20,000 francs, five bags of coal at 1,250 francs; and other  supplies she needs to restock in order to prepare her fritters. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to take care of her children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy one bag  of flour per week; four bags of sugar; five bags of charcoal; and other supplies for preparing fritters.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina con su credikiva pudo surtir su negocio con nuevas colecciones de ropa, calzado, bolsos, perfumería e ingredientes para su producción de bollos; al haber realizado sus compras al por mayor se benefició con descuentos que le permitieron incrementar sus utilidades. Ella está muy feliz por el progreso que ha tenido, ya no solicita dinero a personas agiotistas que le cobraban unas tasas de interés muy elevadas, recursos que utilizaba en función de su negocio, por ello dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Agradezco la ayuda recibida y deseo lo mejor para ustedes y su familia”.  En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará prendas de vestir, calzado, bolsos, perfumería e ingredientes para elaborar de bollos y aprovechar la temporada decembrina con estos productos que son  apropiados para la época por su alta demanda. Su credikiva nuevamente será todo un éxito que beneficiará a su negocio y a su familia.
texts.en:
With her Kiva loan, Adelina was able to stock her business with new collections of clothes, shoes, bags, and perfume, as well as ingredients for bollos (corn buns). Having made her purchases wholesale, she benefited from discounts that enabled her to increase her profits. She is very happy with the progress that she has made. Now she does not have to borrow the money for running her business from usurers that charge very high interest rates, so she would like to say to Kiva lenders: “I am grateful for the help I have received and I wish the best for you and your family”.

She is currently applying for a second loan with Kiva, with which she will buy garments, shoes, bags, perfume, and ingredients for making bread rolls. She will make the most of the holiday season, when these products are in high demand. Her Kiva loan will again be a success and will benefit her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, perfume, handbags, corn, and ingredients.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel es un hombre de 42 años de edad, es un de las personas con profundo agradecimiento a los inversionistas de kiva, pues gracias al apoyo de su crédito él pudo realizar la remodelación de su cocina, pues ahora cuenta con mejor ambiente, con este cambio él está muy contento más no conforme por esa razón nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la remodelación de su baño, pues en una parte esencial de casa que también necesita contar con una buen ambiente, comprara; arena, cemento y piso. Su esperanza de vida es dejarles una buena herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en: Samuel is a 42-year-old man. He is deeply grateful to Kiva investors because he was able to remodel his kitchen thanks to the financial support provided by his Kiva loan. Now he has a better home environment and he is very happy with this improvement, but he wants to keep making improvements. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so he can remodel his bathroom as it is an essential part of the house that also needs to have a good atmosphere. He will buy sand, cement, and flooring. His hope in life is to leave a good inheritance to his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and flooring for remodeling his bathroom

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel runs a retail store selling a variety of clothes (RTW) in their local community just to earn a living. She decided to expand her business and have more inventory stocks to increase her sales. She decided again to take a new loan to buy more RTW clothes to sell, which will generate more income to provide for her family's daily needs. Liezel wants to save more money for her children.

loans.use: to buy more RTW clothes to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny  was able to manage her banana farm that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm has still been doing well and giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs. Recently, she took a new loan to pay the replanting cost for her banana production to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Jenny expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay the replanting cost for her banana production.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 25 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Julieta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, juice, cereals, biscuits, sanitary pads, etc.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 44 years old and married with two children.

Maribel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is 38 years old and has four children. She is widowed and has one child still in school.

Hayde is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Hayde has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Hayde would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa is a 50-year-old woman with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Temukisa requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a wise man who first examines the flow of business before he will go for it. He has been working abroad for a long time, but when he had enough savings he went back home for good and put up a piggery business. Alex is focusing on hogs for breeding. Aside from breeding hogs, he is also raising hogs for fattening. Alex wishes that he could complete his eight sows so that he can produce more piglets every month. Alex needs an additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He hopes to attain his wish sooner to be able to grow the business. His profit serves as sustenance for their daily basic needs. He will also keep some of his earnings for the future of his wife.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and has seven children. She is single and has two children who are still in school.

Juliet is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juliet has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Christina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending business.

Christina dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Genevieve works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Genevieve is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Genevieve has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 49 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Consolacion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elsa has been in business for 12 years now. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 59-year-old mother of 10 children. She owns and operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years.

Ruta requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and fry pan.

loans.name: Melin

texts.en:
Melin is 42 years old, and married with three children. One of her children is in school.

Melin is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Melin has been in this business for ten years. In the future, shewould like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 72 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Flaviana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, detergent soap, coffee, etc.

In the future, Flaviana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en: In the small village in San Juan Pana-on, there is a woman name Medarda. She is 57 years old but still doesn't have a plan to get married because, as for her, she is already content with the happiness that her family gives to her. As she grew up, she helped her parents on the farm. Her father taught her how to plant bananas and coconuts (the main business of the family). When her father died, she took over managing the farm. She started in the year 2005 and now it's already 10 years that she has been managing the business. While roaming around the farm, Medarda saw a vacant lot so she decided to plant more coconuts and bananas in order to earn more income but she needs some funds in order to pursue the plan. She went to Gata Daku MPC to borrow money amounting to PHP 7,OOO to use to buy seedlings. Medarda's plan for the future is to improve her residence house from the profits of her coconut farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for her coconut farm.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 51-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She owns a business at home in which she sells bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blankets, etc. Recently, she spent a huge part of her income to pay utility bills, which diminished her purchasing power to buy new blankets. Now, customers want blankets because the winter season is going to start. Akhtar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her business so she can buy bed sheets, blankets, pillow covers and quilts. In this way, she can easily cope with the increasing demand and generate additional income for her entire family.

Her dream is to provide all facilities to her children.

Akhtar is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, blankets, pillow covers and quilts for her business that she is running from her home.

loans.name: Danaya Ton Group

texts.fr: Diakaria est celui qui a le flacon en main  sur la photo .Il est  malien, âgé de 43 ans, instruit, marié et père de quatre(4) enfants âgés de 8  à 18 ans. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère. Diakaria est un  éleveur de moutons. Il exerce ce métier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend ses animaux dans le marché de sa localité. Le profit qu’il gagne lui permet de subvenir à certains  besoins de sa famille. Il fait recourt au RMCR en vue de développer ses activités. Dans l’avenir, Diakaria souhaite avoir un prêt  plus élevé afin de devenir exportateur de moutons et d’améliorer ses conditions   de vie et celles de sa famille.
texts.en: Diakaria is the one in the photo who has a flask in hand. He is Malian, 43 years old, educated, married and father of four (4) children aged from 8 to 18 years. All of his children are in school. His wife is a housewife. Diakaria is a sheep farmer. He has been practicing this profession for over 10 years. He gets his supplies in the surrounding markets and re-sells his animals in his town's market. The profit that he earns allows him to meet some of his family's needs. He appeals to the RMCR with a view to develop his business. In the future, Diakaria wishes to have a higher loan in order to become a sheep exporter and to improve the living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to sell later.

loans.name: Ferilene

texts.en: Ferilene of Tudela has been involved in a buy and sell business for almost five years now. She’s 35 years old with one child and a husband who is an OFW to help her in providing for her children. She wants to increase her products. Thus, she applied for a loan at GDMPC micro-credit to buy more variety of personal products to sell so that she can increase her inventory and increase her income. As her family gets bigger, she plans to expand her business soon.

loans.use: to buy more variety of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Aiuli

texts.en: Aiuli is a 42-year-old mother with three children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. Aiuli requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, and chemicals, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, and chemicals.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a woman merchant residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 37 years of age, married and has a 10-year-old child. She runs a clothing store, displaying t-shirts, pants, ladies jeans, blouses and shorts for both genders.

Her husband also has an income that can help with the family's daily expenses.

She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the welfare of her child. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to purchase additional stock like shorts, shirts and blouses. In that way, she can display a variety of supplies and attract potential customers.

Slowly, she will be able to settle her obligations and manage her finances wisely.

Lorena would like to expand her business in the future through investing in other business ventures to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shorts, shirts and blouses

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Helen dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Soifua

texts.en: Soifua is a 54-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Soifua requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She will improve her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 45 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 48-year-old lady. All her devotions are for her husband who is earning a very low income. He provides sheltering services for houses under construction; he builds temporary shelters with the help of bamboo and wooden planks so it can support the concrete mixture for two weeks. Most of his work depends upon the contract and most of the time he is unable to get any contract for sheltering services.

Recently, her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Shehnaz has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboo and nails to provide his best services.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of funding the loan.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks, bamboo and nails for her husband's sheltering services so he can be empowered to continue his services.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 56 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She earns a living with her oyster culturing business in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

Adelaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business

loans.name: Benga's Group

texts.en:
Benga is a 51-year-old lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a village in Balugaon, Odisha, India. This humble lady has a family of four. Benga is a farmer by profession and cultivates paddy on her small piece of land. Her husband, being an elderly person, often remains ill and is not able to work anymore. So, Benga is the only breadwinner in her family. She has two daughters. Her elder daughter got married last year and her younger daughter is continuing her studies. After meeting the daily household expenses and the medical expenses of her husband, Benga is hardly able to save any money.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Benga will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course. The loan amount will help her daughter complete her education smoothly and will help her in getting a good job with a pretty good package.

Benga is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is the age of 46 and lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years. He is very expert in his art and he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, and level, which have became worn out. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services but he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy these tools.

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction.

Shehnaz thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mason's tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, and level for her husband's services.

loans.name: Akossiwa Viviane

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Akossiwa est une femme divorcée qui vit à Tokoin. Avec trois enfants à charge, Akossiwa est une femme dynamique qui se bat pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants en préparant de la bouillie et vend aussi des fruits. Akossiwa	sollicite ce prêt pour commander le sac de maïs et des bols de sucre. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Akossiwa répondra favorablement aux besoins de ses clients puis avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives in Tokoin and prepares and sells maize porridge and fruit. She is forty-two years old, divorced and has three children in her care. She is a dynamic woman who works hard to improve conditions for her children.

Akossiwa has requested this loan to buy a sack of maize and bowls of sugar. With this, she will be able to respond to the demands of her customers, increase her sales and improve her profits. This will enable her to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of maize and 10 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Ruth est une veuve femme qui vit avec son enfant à charge à Tokoin. Ruth prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Ruth s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et du sucre en vue de mieux revendre afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ruth lives in Tokoin and prepares and sells maize porridge. She is fifty-five years old, widowed and has one child in her care. Her customers are very happy with the quality of food that she prepares. She buys new supplies three times a month from the market.

Ruth has requested this loan to buy sacks of maize and sugar. With this, she will be able to respond to the demands of her customers, increase her sales and improve her profits. This will enable her to provide for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Roberta works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Roberta is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her peanut butter making business.

Roberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making peanut butter.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old and has five children. Susana is married and two of her children are still in school.

Susana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Susana has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 50 years old and married with five children. Vicky works very hard to provide for them.

Vicky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Vicky has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Vicky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 34-year-old mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner and has been operating a lathe machine for many years. He has been working as a laborer on daily wages and now wants to buy his own lathe machine so he can earn maximum profit for his efforts. A new lathe machine costs more, which he can not afford. This is the reason he decided to purchase a used lathe machine.

Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a used lathe machine and can operate it for manufacturing spare parts.

Shabana hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy a used lathe machine for her husband so he can stop working as a laborer and can manufacture spare parts.

loans.name: Ma. Faith

texts.en:
Ma. Faith is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Faith is 43 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Faith has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, flour and other materials for her food production business.

Ma. Faith has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, flour and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Bidyut's Group

texts.en:
Bidyut is a 30-year-old humble and simple lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph in a pink saree. She hails from a small village in Balugaon, Odisha, India. Bidyut is a married lady and a blessed mother of two sons who are currently studying in a primary school. Her household income is very low and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation.

Therefore, she, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner, Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and shower in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community. Bidyut is awaiting for your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and shower in it.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma supplements her income with earnings from her general store. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Loreny

texts.en:
Ma. Loreny is a 45-year-old widow with four children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Loreny has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as bananas, milk, flour, sugar and cooking oil for her food production business.

Ma. Loreny has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta, who lives in Lapasan on Misamis Occidental, the Philippines, helps support her family through her coconut juice business. She is 45 years old and married with two children, and she tries her best to earn her own income. For fifteen years, she has managed this business and earns about 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) per month. She now needs to pay for the labor costs involved in coconut juice making. Vicenta has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, with which she will also buy ingredients such as coconut and milk.

Vicenta joined GDMPC in 2013. In the future, she wants to expand her family's house and support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making coconut juice.

loans.name: Carlos Guillermo

texts.es:
CARLOS DE 72 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIO DE LEON CASADO CON HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD,  INDEPENDIENTE ECONOMICAMENTE, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO,  Y SUS FAMILIAS, DESDE MUY JOVEN APRENDIO EL OFICIO DE EBANISTERIA Y CARPINTERIA, ACTIVIADAD QUE LA HA DESEMPEÑADO CON MUCHO AMOR Y HA SIDO SU MEDIO DE SUBSISTENCIA PARA SALIR ADELANTE ECONOMICAMENTE. 
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SUPERACION TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA EL SERVICIO DE EBANISTERIA Y CARPINTERIA NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, TIENE DE DESEMPEÑAR DICHA ACTIVIDAD VEINTE AÑOS, EL CUAL LO REALIZA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE HAN SIDO SU FUENTE DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA, LA CUAL HA PODIDO CUMPLIR MUCHAS DE SUS METAS  Y OBJETIVOS PERSONALES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA COMO: MADERA, BARNIS, HERRAMIENTAS, JUNCOS, TORNILLOS, PINTURAS ETC. CARLOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Carlos is 72 years old. He is from Leon, married with adult children, and financially independent. He is currently working day by day to promote his business and to provide for his family. When he was very young he learned the profession of woodworking and carpentry; he has done this work with a lot of love and it has been the means by which he has supported himself financially.

Thanks to his desire to better himself he has a business providing woodworking and carpentry services. His business is located in his home. He has been doing this work for 20 years and he does it with pleasure, as it has sustained him and his family and it has allowed him to achieve many of his personal goals and objectives. This loan will be used as an investment in working capital to buy raw material such as: wood, varnish, tools, cane, screws, paints, etc. Carlos is thankful for the help Kiva's lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can do respectable work.

loans.use: to buy carpentry material, such as wood, cane, tools, screws, paint, leather, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia continúa con su negocio de venta de verduras. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando una caja mecánica para su automóvil, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su mercadería. Actualmente su auto trabaja como taxi y también la transporta a ella junto a toda su mercadería, “mi auto me ayuda con el transporte de la mercadería, y también me deja una renta diaria…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con 2 rentas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar verduras por mayor. Su sueño es terminar de pagar el terreno que se compró para construir su casa, ella desea comprar verduras por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad.	
Es por esos motivos que Cecilia solicita un préstamo para comprar verduras por mayor para abastecer su verdulería.
texts.en:
Cecilia continues to work selling vegetables at her business.

She invested her last loan in a mechanical gearbox for her car. She made her repayments on time as she was able to sell all of her merchandise. Cecilia's vehicle currently serves as both a taxi and a means of transportation for her and her merchandise.

She says, "My car helps me to transport merchandise and also provides me with a daily income."

One strong-point of Cecilia's business is that she has two daily incomes. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy vegetables in bulk.

Cecilia's dream is to finish paying off the land she bought to build her house. Cecilia also wants to buy vegetables in bulk. This is her second loan with Emprender in the nine years that she has had her business.

For the above reasons, Cecilia is applying for a loan in order to buy vegetables in bulk to stock up her vegetable stall.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk to stock up her business.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia ciencias de la educación.
Ella es inteligente, constante y muy estudiosa. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública, caracterizada por conformar un fuerte movimiento social.
Ana es morena de cabello negro y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Ella estudia la carrera de cie3ncias de la educación, se prepara para formar las siguientes generaciones de estudiantes de primaria, “estudio y trabajo ambas actividades ocupan todo mi tiempo…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios ella se dedica a la confección de manteles y fundas para mesas y sillas. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y ejercer su profesión, ella desea comprar una computadora. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Ana is 20 years old, single and has no children. She is studying education.

Ana is intelligent, persevering and very studious. She studies at a public university, known for being part of a strong social movement.

Ana is tanned with black hair; she is short. Her native language is Aymará but she also speaks Spanish. She lives with her parents, who work. The family lives in a house that they own. The house, built with bricks, has all basic services.

Ana is studying primary education and preparing herself to educate the next generations of pupils.

She says, "I study and I work. These activities take up all of my time."

Besides her studies, Ana works selling tablecloths and chair covers. One strong-point of her business and studies is that her timetables do not clash. One disadvantage is that she does not have a laptop with which to continue studying.

Ana's dream is to finish her degree and to work as a teacher. She also wants to buy a computer. This is Ana's first loan with Emprender in the five years that she has had her business and been a student.

For the above reasons, Ana is applying for a loan in order to buy a laptop with which to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to continue studying.

loans.name: Ma. Natividad

texts.en:
Ma. Natividad is a 46-year-old married mother who has two children in school. She is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Natividad has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sindy Merari

texts.es:
Sindy, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño de tres años, vive junto a su madre y hermanos en casa familiar.

Sindy, debido a que ha sido madre soltera y que sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a su hijo, es por eso que se ha dedicado a elaborar tamales de gallina dos veces por semana y su madre le esta ayudando a cuidar a su hijo y a elaborar los tamales.
 
El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar mesas y sillas para ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes, de esa forma lograra tener un mejor negocio e ingresos para darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

El sueño de Sindy, es que su hijo crezca sano y darle lo mejor en la vida y siempre mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Sindy is 22 years old and finished high school. She is a single mother to a three-year-old boy. Sindy lives in her family home with her mother and siblings.

As a single mother who has to help her son to move forward alone, Sindy works make chicken tamales twice a week. Sindy's mother helps her to look after her son and to make the tamales.

Sindy will use this loan to buy more chairs and tables so that her customers will be more comfortable. She can thus have a better business and income, and give her son a higher quality of life.

Sindy's dream is for her son to grow up health, and to give him the best possible life. She also wants to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables so that her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.name: Juan Mauricio

texts.es:
Juan, de 34 años de edad, no estudio, está casado, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos pequeños y viven en casa propia.

Juan, desde hace muchos años es motorista, tiene un pick-up para hacer viajes a muchos lugares, el 
adquirió su vehículo debido a que ya tiene su familia y quiere darles lo que ellos necesitan; su horario de trabajo es a 
cualquier hora porque a veces le llaman de emergencia, para llevar a alguien al hospital o al cualquier otra parte.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar repuestos y pintura para su vehículo, así estará en mejores condiciones y los clientes tendrán mayor seguridad.

El sueño de Juan, es mejorar las condiciones de vida para que sus hijos vivan en mejor.
texts.en:
Juan, 34 years old, did not go to school. He is married; his wife takes care of the household chores. The couple has two young children. The family lives in a house that they own.

For many years, Juan has made a living as a driver. He has a pick-up truck that he uses to make trips to many places. He bought the vehicle because he had a family and wanted to give them what they need. Juan works whenever he has to - sometimes he is called to help with emergencies, to take people to hospital and all sorts of other places.

Juan will use this loan to buy spare parts and paint for his vehicle. The vehicle will thus be in better conditions, and customers will be safe.

Juan's dream is to improve his living conditions so that his children can live better.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and paint for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos pequeños, uno va a la escuela y el otro se queda en casa.

José, tiene cinco años de tener un taller de reparación de bicicletas, empezó como ayudante y luego se propuso colocar su propio negocio, ahora el es el dueño y tiene dos ayudantes, el horario de trabajo es de 7: AM a 5: P.M.
 
José, necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos como: llantas, rines y otros materiales que necesita para su taller, de esa forma logrará tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.

El sueño de José, es mantener su negocio bien establecido y que siempre le genere ingresos, para brindarle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and he has a second-grade education. He is in a relationship and his partner is a homemaker. He has two small children, one of whom is in school while the other is still at home.

José has had a bicycle repair shop for five years. He started as an apprentice and then set out to start his own business. Now he is the owner and he has two assistants. His work schedule is from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.

José needs this loan to buy parts, such as: tires, rims, and other materials he needs for his shop. This will allow him to have a better quality of life with his family.

José's dream is to keep his business in good standing and making money so he can provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy parts, such as: tires, rims, and other materials he needs for his shop.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a fishing business in the Philippines for two years now. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy new fishing materials like fishing nets, bamboo and gasoline.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing materials such as fishing nets, bamboo and gasoline.

loans.name: Elcin

texts.en:
Elcin is a 26-year-old married farmer. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives with family in the Bilesuvar region. Elcin is a steady and very dynamic man. He has been working in this job for 20 years. He cares about leading a healthy life so he is always working toward that end.

Elcin wants to buy new, cleaner, safer farming equipment. This will help him to grow more healthy organic seeds, so he has requested money and support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new farming equipment.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús, de 24 años de edad, estudio técnico agrónomo, está casado, su esposa trabaja vendiendo ropa y tienen un niño pequeño.

Jesús, es empleado en una gasolinera y trabaja en la jornada de la mañana todos los días, pero también tiene un taller de reparación de refrigeradoras y cocinas, pero lo administra otra persona y por las tardes se incorpora para ayudar en su taller.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar repuestos para su taller. 

El sueño de Jesús, es mejorar su negocio y tener más demanda de clientes y seguir aportando ingresos para su esposa y su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Jesus is 24 years old. He studied agronomy. He is married and his wife works selling clothing and they have a young son.

Jesus is an employee at a gas station and he works the morning shift every day, but he also has a shop where he repairs refrigerators and stoves, but another person manages it and in the afternoons he shows up to help out in his shop.

The loan he is requesting is to buy parts for his shop.

Jesus's dream is to improve his business and have more of a customer demand and to keep generating income for his wife and young son.

loans.use: to buy parts for his shop.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.pt: O Sr. Orlando é casado, vive com a esposa e quatro filhos. É militar. Com o presente empréstimo pretende materiais de construção nomeadamente cimento, ferro, areia e pedras. Tem sonho de terminar de construir a sua casa. Tem como maior desafio o financiamento.
texts.en: Orlando is married and lives with his wife and four children. He is a soldier. He plans to use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand, and stones. His dream is to finish building his house. His biggest challenge is acquiring the needed financing.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, and stone.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
María, manifiesta que si no fuera por el apoyo que tiene mediante los créditos su negocio no continuara en el mercado, actualmente tiene mayor estabilidad económica y puede dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año está solicitando un financiamiento con el que podrá comprar zapatos en mayor cantidad y a bajos precios, considera que estará preparada para el periodo de buenas ventas en época de fin de año y así respaldara el pago de la nueva deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
María says that, without the support of loans, her business would not still be open. She currently has more financial stability and can provide her family with better living conditions.

In order to take advantage of the end-of-year celebrations, María is applying for a loan that she will use to buy shoes in bulk at low prices. María thinks she will be prepared for the high season at the end of the year, and this will help her to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk at low prices.

loans.name: Edith Yaneth

texts.es:
Edith es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, actualmente se dedica a elaborar tortillas para vender, sus parientes le poyan económicamente, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre, hace más de cinco años que decidió fundar su propio negocio para costear sus gastos, por temporadas ofrece otros productos como ropa, cosméticos, lácteos, etc., 
Comprará maíz, leña, bolsas, cal, y quesos, podrá mantener la continuidad de sus actividades y atenderá mejor a sus clientes, espera generar más ingresos, apoyar un poco más a su familia y ofrecer nuevos productos de calidad.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Edith is a single mother. She lives in her parents' house. She currently makes a living producing and selling tortillas. Her parents support her financially. Edith learned this trade from her mother. She decided to start her own business five years ago in order to cover household expenses. At certain times of the year Edith also sells other products such as clothes, cosmetics, dairy products and more.

Edith will use this loan to buy corn, firewood, bags, lime and cheese in order to sustain her business and better serve her customers. Edith hopes to earn a higher income, support her family and little more, and to sell new, quality products.

Edith's dreams are to expand her business, own her own house, and to move forward with her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags, lime and cheese in order to sustain her business and better serve her customers.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es empleada, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores de edad y el otro menor y viven en casa de sus padres.

Ana, tiene once años de ser empleada en un deposito de telas, pero también se dedica a vender productos por catalogo en sus ratos libres; ella decidió trabajar también de esa manera, porque ha tenido crecer sola a sus hijos y están 
estudiando y requiere más ingresos para sacarlos adelante.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para damas, caballeros y niños, para venderlas en época navideña, de esa manera lograra mejorar sus ingresos y comprarles ropa nueva a sus hijos para Diciembre.

Ana, desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y que trabajen honrada.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and completed high school. She has a job. She is a single mother to three children, two of whom are now adults while the youngest in still under the age of 18. The family lives in Ana's parents' house.

Ana has been working at a shop selling material for eleven years. In addition she sells goods from catalogues. She does this in her spare time because she has had to raise her children alone; they are in education and Ana needs a higher income to help them to move forward.

Ana needs this loan in order to buy products for men, women and children to sell at Christmas. She can thus increase her income and buy her children new clothes in December.

Ana wants her children to learn a profession and for them to do honest work.

loans.use: to buy products for men, women and children to sell at Christmas.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A cliente Rosa é comerciante de 58 anos de idade,viúva e mãe de 05 filhos, dos quais 04 já maiores de idade, 01 a frequentar o ensino secundário, vive  na casa própria e sustenta ainda 07 netos órfãos .
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar chapas, barrotes, pranchas,  pregos, 02 portas, areia , pedra, 04 janelas para dar continuidade da sua obra.
A cliente tem como sonho e ter uma barraca, fazer casas para arrendar e comprar um carro, com o empréstimo anterior fez a casa ate ao nível em que si encontra hoje.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Rosa has her own business. She is 58 years old, widowed, and the mother of five children, four of whom are adult and one of whom is in high school. She lives in her own home and also supports 7 orphaned grandchildren.

She plans to use this loan to buy sheet metal, beams, planks, nails, two doors, sand, stone, and four windows to continue the construction on her house.

Her dream is to have an awning, build houses to rent out, and buy a car. She used her previous loan to pay for the construction of her house to its current phase.

Her biggest challenges are financial ones. She is working and intends to apply for more loans so she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy sheet metal, beams, planks, nails, two doors, sand, stone, and four windows to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
A senhora Carlota tem 36 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 02 filhos que frequentam o ensino escolar e   vive na casa própria.
É negociante desde 2005. vende roupa usada que adquire em fardos e com este empréstimo, vai comprar mais fardos de roupa usada sobretudo a roupa que tem mais saida neste verão para reforçar o negócio.
Sonha em continuar com o negócio e também abraçar outros negócios como o de salão de beleza e melhorar as condições habitacionais. As didficuldades que enfrenta neste momento são financeiras.
texts.en:
Carlota is 36 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children who are in school. She lives in her own home.

She has had her own business since 2005. She sells secondhand clothing that she purchases in bales, and she will use this loan to buy more clothing, especially summer clothing, to strengthen her business.

Her dream is to continue her current business, open other businesses such as a beauty salon, and improve her living conditions. The biggest challenges she currently faces are economic in nature.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing, especially summer clothing, to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a poultry business where she sells chickens and eggs. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Halima's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a business selling peanuts in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more peanuts.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Meriam runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her store, such as rice, hair conditioners, diapers, canned goods and eggs.

Meriam has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of household items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman, 52 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nida has a printing shop business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like ink and paper for her business, and to cover maintenance costs.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like ink and paper, and cover maintenance costs for her business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is aged 52 and lives along with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She runs a small business at home with the help of her daughters. Her practice is to paste sequins, pearls and precious stones over shirts, and she has been selling them in the market. She wants to increase her production, and for this is reason she wants to buy additional raw materials.

Razia has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will utilize the amount to purchase sequins, gum, pearls and stones to increase her business. Her wish is to provide better education and medical facilities for her children.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy sequins, gum, pearls and stones to paste over shirts for selling in the market.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero, no tiene hijos, nadie depende de él, su manera de generar ingresos para salir adelante es atender su propia peluquería y brindar el servicio de masajes, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Para mejorar el inventario de su negocio está solicitando un crédito para comprar vaselina, presto barbas, gel para el cabello, etc., tendrá a su disposición los materiales necesarios para atender mejor a sus clientes, tiene la esperanza que lleguen nuevos clientes a su negocio para generar más ganancias.
Su visión es tener un buen record crediticio y tener un mejor desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
Juan is single and has no children or dependents. He generates income to get ahead through his hairdressers and massage service. He attends to his customers from 6am until 5pm and has encountered no difficulties with his business so far.

In order to improve his business’s inventory, Juan is requesting a loan to buy Vaseline, shavers and hair gel etc., so that he has the necessary equipment to look after his clients. He hopes that his business will gain new customers so that he can increase his profit.

Juan’s vision is to have a good credit record and better personal development.

loans.use: to buy hairdessing materials such as vaseline, shavers and hair gel etc.

loans.name: Ma. Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Shirley works hard to support her family. She has a business selling wood in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store. Ma. Shirley is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more kinds of wood to sell.

Ma. Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of wood to sell.

loans.name: Sofia Brendaly

texts.es:
Sofía, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, está trabajando y actualmente vive en casa de sus padres.

Sofía, no tiene experiencia en el negocio de pupusas, pero su madre si tiene experiencia y juntas quieren colocar este negocio para beneficio de ambas.
 
El préstamo, lo solicita para comprar una plancha, porque su madre pondrá un negocio y ella le apoyara los fines de semana, de esa manera lograrán obtener otros ingresos y servirán para los gastos de la casa.

El sueño de Sofía, es que sus padres siempre tengan lo necesario, para que vivan mejor y siempre apoyarles en lo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Sofía, 21, studied up until high school. She is single and is currently living with her parents. Sofía doesn’t have any experience in the pupusa (stuffed tortilla) business, but her mother does and they want to set up this business together to benefit them both.

The loan they are requesting will be used to buy a grill so that Sofía’s mother will be able to run the business and she will help on the weekends. This way they will be able to increase their income which will cover the household expenses.

Sofía’s dream is that her parents will always have the essentials and live in better conditions, and to always help them with whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy a grill to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 53 years old and married.

Salvacion is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Salvacion requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, 29, lives with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. Wool is used in making blankets. There is no better kind of the blanket than a blanket made by hand, though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure; he knots blankets over nights. This is the reason her husband sells them at a high price, but the problem is the customers do not always agree upon the demanded cost. Nevertheless, the demand for fine blankets has been increasing over time.

Her husband wants to buy more materials for knotting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets and it could become the cause for an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy material such as wool etc for her husband's blankets business.

loans.name: Olinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olinda elabora y vende pasteles, oficio que aprendió siendo empleada,  tiene su  negocio propio desde hace 14 años, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde; Olinda es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, es la persona responsable de darles alimentación, vestuario y salud a sus hijos, no tiene apoyo económico de parientes en el extranjero.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo que utilizara para comprar harina, azúcar, harina, manteca, etc., con lo cual elaborara mayor cantidad de pasteles para mantener su negocio, espera que las ventas incrementen, su dificultad es la competencia que tiene a su alrededor.
Su sueño es tener una pastelería más grande en la que pueda ofrecer nuevos productos y ganar prestigio entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olinda makes and sells cakes, a profession that she learned while she was employed. Now she has her own business, which has been in operation for 14 years. She works from seven in the morning until five in the evening. Olinda is a single mother who lives with her two children. She is the person responsible for providing food, clothing, and everything else they need for their well-being. She receives no economic support from family members living abroad.

Olinda is requesting a loan that she will use to buy flour, sugar, butter, etc., to make more cakes so that she can maintain her business. She hopes to increase her sales, her challenge being the competition in her area.

Olinda's dream is to have a larger bakery where she can offer new products and gain prestige among her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, etc., to make more cakes so that she can maintain her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Ice cream is a favorite dessert of many people, especially in a tropical country like the Philippines. It’s quite refreshing during dry season with hot weather, and it’s also appealing even during rainy season.

Lydia, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, chose to venture into ice cream making many years ago. She took advantage of the good supply of fruits in their place and made it into delicious ice cream. She was able to improve her business and is now capable of helping eight ice cream vendors. Ice cream vendors are commonly seen with movable carts roving in different communities, either urban or rural. They use a ringing bell to call the attention of the residents to buy from them.

Lydia would like to buy another cart and employ another vendor soon. She also needs additional supplies of fruits, milk, and other ice cream ingredients. She appeals for a PHP 30,000 loan for this purpose. Additional income that will be derived from this will continuously provide for her family’s daily needs and the needs of her eight vendors.

Lydia is married to Edgardo. They want to bestow a successful business to their children someday.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another ice cream cart and additional supplies of fruits, milk, and other ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Melvie

texts.en:
Melvie works hard to support her family. Melvie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

In the future, Melvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Walter Benjamin

texts.es:
Walter, vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos, su ocupación y fuente de ingresos es dar a sus vecinos el servicio de transporte privado,  realiza sus viajes donde ellos le soliciten, cuenta con los permisos correspondientes y tiene 5 años de ejercerlo.
Requiere de un préstamo para pagar la reparación y cambio de llantas de su unidad de transporte, con ello evitara problemas para atender a sus clientes y les brindará la seguridad necesaria, sus planes son generar más ingresos para resarcir su deuda con responsabilidad.
Walter tiene como objetivo aprovechar la oportunidad de trabajar con créditos para ayudar a su familia a tener un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Walter lives with his parents in their home and earns a living by providing his neighbours with private transport services, making journeys wherever they request. He has the relevant permits and has 5 years of experience.

Walter is requesting a loan to pay for the repair and replacement of tyres on his vehicle so that he can avoid any problems looking after his customers and provide them with the safety that is required. He plans to increase his income to repay the debt responsibly.

Walter aims to seize the opportunity to work with loans in order to help his family to have a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and replacement of tyres on his vehicle.

loans.name: Shantilata's Group

texts.en:
Shantilata, 42 is the lady standing to the right in the photograph. She hails from a village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. She is the blessed mother of one son and two daughters and takes care of them single-handedly as she is a single mother.

Shantilata was devastated after her husband left her, but with the passage of time, she was able to rebuild her confidence and stood rock strong in order to support herself and her children.

She is engaged in making cushions and soft toy items. She purchases materials from the nearby town and sells them in the city. In this way, she earns her living and provides education to her children.

Shantilata, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase the prerequisite materials for her business like cotton, thread, colorful clothes, glitters, ribbons and glue. The loan amount will help her in making cushions and soft toys in a voluminous amount, thereby increasing her sales.

Subsequently, the loan will result in a better standard of living and a happy and peaceful life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase the prerequisite materials for her business like cotton, thread, colorful clothes, glitters, ribbons and glue.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María solicita un nuevo rédito para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas para darle un buen desarrollo a la milpa y pagara obreros para que le ayuden a realizar los trabajos agrícolas, asimismo comprara concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos, de esta forma continuara progresando.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior la producción de granos básicos ha sido favorable, cuido mejor a los cerdos y los vendió a mejores precios, actualmente no está vendiendo ropa.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting another loan to invest in agricultural supplies for providing a good development for the cornfield and to pay the worker who will help her with agricultural tasks. Also, she will buy concentrate to feed the pigs so she will continue to progress.

With the help of the previous loan the productivity of basic grains improved, she was able to care better for the pigs and sell them at better prices. At the moment, she is not selling clothes.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies for providing a good development for the cornfield and to pay the worker who will help her with agricultural tasks.

loans.name: Rosa Cruz

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 20 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene en su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and lives in her own house together with her husband.

She has been earning a living by making clothes for twenty years. Her tailor shop is located in her home and has many customers, due to the quality of the clothing she makes. With what she earns from her work she is covering the expenses that arise in her household.

She is requesting this loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, rubber bands, and so on. Thus, she will be able to continue with her work, which generates a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, rubber bands, and so on.

loans.name: Fraternidad De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Celedonia, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche, café, leche, quinua con manzana entre otros, la socia continua vendiendo de forma ambulatoria para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como azúcar, leche, entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos  y  una foto adicional ya que los socios pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
texts.en:
The members belong to a communal bank called "Fraternidad de Urubamba". This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Celedonia. She continues her business of selling breakfasts such as quinoa with milk, coffee, milk, quinoa with apples, among others. The member continues to sell through her mobile store for her clients that ask her to. She has dedicated herself to her business for two years, which gives her personal satisfaction. She desires to be able to continue working in this way to support her family.

The member seeks a loan for the purchase of consumable goods such as sugar and milk, among others. The members in general are appreciative to those who are a part of this dream, and they commit to make the payments in the set timeframe. The picture was taken in two groups, and there is an additional picture since the members asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of health and work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods such as sugar and milk, among others.

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal WAYNA CCAPAC ,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento de Cusco.
La socia Isabel  tiene 35 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los demás socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio que sale adjunto a la foto pidio permsiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "WAYNA CCAPAC" Communal Bank. This bank is located in the province of Urubamba, belonging to the department of Cusco. Member Isabel is 35 years old, has three children, and is in a common-law marriage. She spends her time working in her small grocery store. She has had this business for a while, and it's going well, thanks to the dedication that she puts in every day to her business.

She hopes to continue working and supporting her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and other products. The other members of the group are thankful for the loans lent to them and are committed to fulfilling the established payment schedules.

The man in the corner of the photo asked for permission to arrive late to the group meeting because of work related reasons.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline's main income comes from planting and harvesting vegetables in her garden. Evangeline is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental and has been farming for 10 years, earning PHP 5,000 a month.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizers and spray insecticide to prevent insects in her vegetables. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide and fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para realizar sus actividades agrícolas de esta temporada, invertirá específicamente en abono para fortalecer el cultivo de maíz, de esta manera tendrá oportunidad mejorar la producción de granos.
Con el crédito anterior la cosecha de maíz y frijol ha sido muy favorable para alimentar a su familia y para generar recursos económicos con los que cubre otras necesidades, gracias a ello no ha tenido mayores dificultades por la falta de lluvias que había en ese momento.
texts.en:
Juan has decided on a new loan to carry out his agricultural activities of this season. He will specifically invest in compost to strengthen the corn crop. This way, he will have an opportunity to improve the grain production.

With the previous loan, the corn and bean crop yields have been very favorable to feed his family and to generate economic resources with which he covers other needs. Thanks to it, he hasn't had major difficulties despite the lack of rain that existed at that moment.

loans.use: to invest in compost to strengthen the corn crop.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doña Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su casa pero no posee de duficiente capital por esa razon solicita a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion para terminar de arreglar su casa y asi tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old an lives in her own house together with her son. She has been owning a tailor shop, which is located in her home, for 8 years. With what she makes from her work she is covering some household expenses.

She wants to finish the construction of her house, but does not have sufficient capital. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL: to buy construction materials for finishing the repairs on her house and thus have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Scollar

texts.en:
Scollar is a married woman with one child. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour, milk, bread, and other household items. Scollar has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations.

Scollar will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more bread, soap, flour, milk, and other items to sell. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loans successfully. Scollar will use the anticipated profits to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, soap, flour, milk, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Soledad Yesenia

texts.es:
Soledad, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo es empelado, tiene dos hijos, uno estudia segundo grado y el otro aún no ingresa a la escuela. 

Soledad, se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa desde hace más de 12 años y aprendió el negocio porque su madre a eso se ha dedicado, además vende joyas de acero y enchape, ella sale tres veces por semana a las comunidades y cantones cercanos y también vende en su casa, los otros días de semana es ayudante un comedor. 

Soledad, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa de mujer y niños, para no quedarse sin inventario y siempre generar ingresos para su hogar. 

Los sueños de Soledad, son mantener su negocio y vender al por mayor y educar a sus hijos para que en un futuro puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Soledad, 34 years old, studied up to fourth grade, is married and her husband is employed. She has two children. One of them is studying in second grade and the other one has not started school yet.

Soledad has been selling clothes for more than 12 years. She learned the trade because her mother had the same occupation. She also sells steel-plated jewellery. Three times a week, she goes out to the communities and cantons nearby. She also sells from her house. During the rest of the week, she works as an assistant at an eatery.

Soledad needs the loan to buy women's and children's clothing so that she does not run out of inventory and so that she can always earn an income for her household.

Soledad's dreams are to keep up her business, go into wholesale and educate her children so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing so that she does not run out of inventory and so that she can always earn an income for her household.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
Meybur es  una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 5 años, y su negocio es la peluquería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural caracterizada por acopiar la producción agrícola para ser distribuida a la ciudad.
