This loan will improve Phibian’s living conditions and secure the future of her children. It is clear that this lady is determined to reach her goal, and her request should be considered. Make a loan!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Jane, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past ten years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Jane says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.”

Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day, and this helps her support her family.

Jane also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality beans, potato and vegetable seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production.

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Jane believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Jane’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.Is) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Lydia, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mom. She hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya. She loves and treasures her family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Lydia earns an income through selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income.

She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for the past two years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mom has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandihills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Lydia’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mom has been making great improvements in life, and she believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Lydia has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with her finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business.

Lydia is a visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

The difficult circumstances that have befallen this woman, as well as her push to overcome them, make her deserving of the help she is requesting. Be inspired make a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
At the tender age of 20, Magrate's passion for farming and education drove her to start practicing mixed farming. Right now she is 52 and a very industrious, honest, and hardworking mother from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment.

Over the years of farming, Magrate has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Margaret is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy seeds.

Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that Magrate could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Magrate, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring smallholder women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Magrate believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food.

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and will increase her business. Increased profits will allow Magrate to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Magrate has many dreams in her life but, as expected, her family is the principal one: she wants to give them a good quality of life, to pay for her children's education and, someday, buy a house so that they can all live safely and comfortably. You can help Magrate to fulfill all of these goals with a loan that will get her a lot closer to achieving them.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has five children. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. His highest annual expense is food and education.

The major challenge that Ronald faces is poor access to transportation services. Ronald is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With the motorcycle, Ronald will be able to distribute his produce in new locations far from his home.

Your loan investment will enable Ronald to participate in formal markets where he will get better prices for his produce, grow interdependent relationships, and explore new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Doreen started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Katharaka, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy building. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy building. With the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy building provides a place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Doreen believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy building. Doreen waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy building.

loans.name: Annis

texts.en:
Annis is a smallholder farmer based in the central area of Kenya, where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. Her main source of income is milk. Annis aspires to grow her business, earn more income and take good care of her family.

One way that Annis can improve her business is by ensuring her cows are more productive. Today, she is seeking a loan that will help her to introduce zero-grazing on her farm. The borrowed money will be used to buy tools and materials for constructing a cowshed that contains a confined feeding area for the livestock.

After implementing the zero-grazing technique, Annis expects to cut costs and earn more income from using the grazing area of land to grow fodder and vegetables. Since the cows will not have to constantly move around for pasture, the saved energy will be concentrated on the production of milk.

Your loan investment will change Anni's milk business and improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: To introduce zero-grazing for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Sarah, a 33-year-old mum who is so humble and honest - a very hardworking mum on this planet Earth. Sarah has a lovely family that she really adores very much. She will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Sarah hails from the Kitale area of Kenya.

Sarah never had the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Sarah started farming and has been doing crop and dairy farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience, and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Sarah practices mixed farming on her farm. Through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

Sarah is a mother who is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Sarah wants to take advantage of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products to reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Sarah to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Sarah hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions.

Sarah's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Sarah is not a selfish mum and also wants to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

Contribute to this mum’s life - grant her a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Honrick

texts.en:
Honrick is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has seven children. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. His highest annual expense is food and education.

The major challenge that Honrick faces is poor access to transportation services. He is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain, and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With this motorcycle, Honrick will be able to distribute his produce in new locations far from his home.

Your loan investment will also enable him to participate in formal markets where he will get better prices for his produce, grow interdependent relationships, and explore new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He is married and has eight children. He makes a living doing livestock and crop farming. His highest annual expense is food and education.

The major challenge that Francis faces is poor access to transportation services. Francis is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain, and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas.
With this motorcycle, he will be able to distribute his produce in new locations far from his home.

Your loan investment will enable Francis to participate in formal markets where he will get better prices for his produce, grow interdependent relationships, and explore new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds to start horticulture farming and also to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rubys

texts.es: Rubys es una microempresaria de 45 años, habitante de Barranquilla un municipio del departamento del Atlántico en donde funcionan sus confecciones de ropa, proyecto que emprendió luego de haber laborado por años en empresas de este mismo sector, en donde logró perfeccionar su trabajo y conocer a fondo sobre esta actividad. Ella tomó clases de modistería y maquinas planas, de este modo logró adquirir el conocimiento necesario para conseguir empleo y generar recursos, sin embargo deseaba ser independiente para estar más tiempo con su familia; al ser madre de una niña, deseaba velar por su educación y buenas costumbres, así que no dudó en tomar la decisión que le cambió significativamente la vida y que hoy en día está muy satisfecha de los resultados que tiene tanto en el negocio como en su vida personal. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, familiares y colegios a quienes ofrece servicios de diseño y confección, bien sea sobre medidas y cuando son volúmenes grandes por tallas. Con la finalidad mantener un stock de materia prima que respalde su producción, está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo lo invertirá en telas exclusivamente. Su meta a futuro es tener una sucursal de su negocio y continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubys is a 45 year-old small business owner. She is a resident of Barranquilla, a city in the Atlántico department, where she makes clothing. This is a project she began after having worked for years in companies in the same sector, and having managed to perfect her skills and knowledge. She took classes in dressmaking and single needle flat sewing machines, and thus managed to acquire the necessary knowledge to get jobs and generate income.

However, she wanted to be self-employed in order to spend more time with her family. She is the mother of a little girl, and wanted to be vigilant of her education and good manners, so she did not hesitate to make the decision that significantly changed her life, and today she is very pleased with the results, both in her business and in her personal life.

Her main customers are neighbors, friends and colleagues, to whom she offers her designs and dressmaking services, either on special order, or in large quantities of one size. In order to maintain a stock of raw materials to support her production, she is applying for a loan, which is her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest the loan exclusively in cloth. Her future goal is to have another branch of her business and to continue to support her family.

loans.use: to invest exclusively in cloth.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a dynamic, entrepreneurial, industrious and honest 26-year-old woman who resides in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. During that time, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers from her village.

Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her to make ends meet. Nancy is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. Therefore, she is seeking this loan to buy cereal. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Nancy could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Nancy, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring female farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Nancy believes that this loan will be of much help. The extra income earned will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Nancy to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going child.

Nancy's main dream is to offer a great variety of cereal products to expand her client base and sales, thereby improving her well-being.

If there is someone you should not think twice about lending to, then that person is Nancy!

loans.use: to buy cereal

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline’s young age hasn't stopped her from fighting for her dreams. She is a happy mother because just few years ago the greatest joy arrived to her home, her infant child whom she loves and gives everything for.

Everline farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows and has a side motorcycle business. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, Everline is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of her produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. She mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Everline is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan Everline is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle but Everline feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Everline will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market, and also she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.

Make a loan now and be a part of Everline's dreams.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike for fast delivery of her products to the market.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Most Kenyans struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Doreen, 30, who is based in the Nkubu area of Kenya and is the mother of two lovely children.

Doreen has been practicing mixed farming for the past twenty years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming, and personal business. Through these ventures, she has been able to make ends meet.

Doreen and her family live in the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities. Doreen is very enterprising. Through farming, she has been able to support her family, although she faces challenges. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements that will help increase production.

With this loan, Doreen will be able to completely turn her life around because the production level on her farm will increase, and this means more income. Through this loan, she will be able to assure her family of improved living standards.

Doreen is confident that the new profits will allow her to comfortably repay the loan. She intends to purchase more land with the savings that she will accumulate, and this will assure her family of a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a smallholder farmer who lives and works on a small farm in the Kitale area of Kenya.

She makes a living doing dairy, crop and vegetable farming. Alice enjoys her job as a farmer because it provides food, income, and a livelihood for her family. Besides farming being a means of securing the basic necessities for life, she finds self-respect and fulfilment knowing that what she does feeds her nation.

In the area of Kenya where Alice operates, there is a huge deficit in terms of access to financial products and services. For years, Alice has had yields and incomes that are far below what they could have been because she can't afford quality agricultural inputs.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through this partnership, financial services are now available to farmers like Alice.

Alice is seeking a loan to buy important agricultural inputs ahead of the planting season. These farm inputs include seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Noemi Magdalena

texts.es:
Noemi, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es madre soltera, el padre de sus hijos le ayuda un poco con los gastos de sus hijos, pero la mayoria de los gastos solo los realiza ella y sus tres hijos van a la escuela.

Noemi, desde hace varios años trabaja como empleada doméstica, sus patronos trabajan y ella se queda haciendo los quehaceres como planchar, lavar y cocinar, etc

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar materiales para hacer pupusas para vender y que su madre se lo administre, de esa manera lograra tener otros ingresos adicionales y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
 
El sueño de Noemi, es que el negocio cada crezca y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Noemi is 28, a single mother and studied up to fifth grade. Her three children attend school and the father of her children helps a little with the costs of bringing them up but she covers most of the costs.

For several years Noemi has worked as a housemaid. Her employers go to work while she remains to do chores like ironing, washing and cooking.

The loan she is applying for is to buy materials to make and sell tortillas which means she can earn additional money and have a better income. Her mother helps her manage the money.

Noemi's dream is that the business grows and improves the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
The Kitale area of Kenya is a remote town where people work the land and raise animals. Unfortunately, the people who do this work face many problems, like the high costs of inputs, the weather, or bad seasons.

Cicilia is aware of these issues but always finds a way to come through. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy and crop farming to provide for her family. She enjoys farming, for it is her means of securing the basic necessities for life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, resulting farmers' yields and incomes that are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers in Kitale now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use in their farms. Cicilia is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to both repay her loan and elevate the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Thirty years ago, Alice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kitale, a remote town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kitale area. Alice has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry flock, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry.

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, enterprising women like Alice can achieve their dreams and goals.

Alice believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

Kindly lend to Alice to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet's desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her young age and the obstacles she has experienced, she does not reduce her efforts to achieve her objective: what she sets out for she gets.

Janet farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 5 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Janet has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, Janet is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. She mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her.

Janet is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. She is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Janet is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Janet feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Janet will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. She will also increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market.

Janet is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping with the farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.

Like Janet, many poor smallholder farmers await your help. Get inspired; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of her farm produce to market.

loans.name: Niobe Del Rosario

texts.es: Niobe es una microempresaria de 45 años que encontró en el comercio informal una forma de ingreso en beneficio de su familia, ella reside con su cónyuge y su hijo de 17 años de edad en un barrio ubicado en Soledad un municipio del Atlántico en donde se encuentran la gran mayoría de sus clientes, puesto que en las instalaciones de su vivienda está situado su almacén misceláneo. Su idea de negocio inicialmente consistía en vender prendas de vestir por encargos de sus clientes, posteriormente colocó una vitrina en su vivienda y la surtió con artículos de bajo costo, poco a poco sus clientes le solicitaron artículos de papelería, productos de belleza, de este modo fue identificando cada una de las necesidades de sus clientes y otorgándoles una solución al ampliar sus líneas de productos.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir prendas de vestir, papelería, cosméticos, y en productos de ferretería puesto que sus clientes le han manifestado su interés en ellos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y costear los estudios profesionales de su hijo.
texts.en:
Niobe is a 45-year-old small businesswoman. She works in the informal economy to bring in income to benefit her family. She lives with her spouse and 17-year-old son. They live in a neighborhood located in Soledad, a city in the Atlántico Department. This is where the majority of her customers are, because she runs a general store from her home.

Her business plan initially was to sell clothing by order for her customers. Later, she added a display case in her home and stocked it with inexpensive items. Little by little, her customers began to ask for stationery and paper, and beauty products. In this way, she began to understand each of her customer's needs, and began meeting those needs by expanding her product line.

Now, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest in clothing, stationery and paper, beauty products, and hardware, because these are the items that her customers are interested in. Her goal is to grow her business and fund her son's professional studies.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, stationery and paper, cosmetics, and in hardware, because her customers have shown interest in those things.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is 40 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. Mary wants to take the world by storm. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and poultry and has a small cash crop garden and trees.

To earn additional income, Mary arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers and makes a commission on those sales. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Mary can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her good understanding of market conditions and prices to sell the produce at a profit. Your loan will help Mary’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Mary dreams of leaving the business to her children, but before that, she wants to pay for their education so that they can be professional.

You can get this mum closer to her dreams with just a loan. Support Mary’s dream by giving her a loan!

loans.use: to buy products from farmers to resell (cereals)

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, and crop farming to provide for her family. Besides being a farmer she also does some side business.

Rosemary's family is comprised of herself, her husband, and 6 children. She enjoys farming because it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Kitale area of Kenya where Rosemary lives, the population depends on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholder farmers around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers like Rosemary can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Rosemary is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help Rosemary fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and elevate the quality of life for her family.

For Rosemary her 6 children are everything, and she wants them to be successful professionals. That’s why she dreams of paying for the best education for them. You can help Rosemary to accomplish that. A little trust and a loan will make much difference in her life and in her family’s.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She works untiringly every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday. She lives in Kitale, a remote town in Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and earn extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

Gladys lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking access to funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, Gladys intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will earn will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

Kindly lend to Gladys to maintain her big smile!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Sara Lorena

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen un hijo de 9 años y una hija de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de víveres.
Ella es buena madre, paciente y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘tejada rectangular’ área residencial, dónde se dieron los primeros asentamientos para luego la fundación de la ciudad. 
Sara es morena de cabello castaño y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en el transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de víveres como; fideo, azúcar, arroz, ollas y otros, “inicie mi negocio vendiendo víveres a mujeres comideras, también les vendo a pedido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar aceites y ollas. Su sueño es incrementar su mercadería, ella desea comprar aceite y ollas para sus clientas comideras. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sara solicita un préstamo para comprar ollas y aceite para sus clientas comideras.
texts.en:
Sara is a 30 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 9 year old son and a 5 year old daughter. Her business is selling food.

She is a good mother, patient and very responsible. Her business takes place in the 'Tejada Rectangular’ residential area where the first settlements where that founded the city.

Sara is dark-skinned with brown hair and thin. Her native tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who works in transportation and her children who study in school. They live in a rented room made of brick and cement that has all the basic services.

Her business is selling food like noodles, sugar, rice, oils and others. "I started my business selling foods to women who make meals. I also sold on request", she commented. The advantage of her business is she has continuous customers, her disadvantage is the lack of money to buy oil and margarine. Her dream is to increase her merchandise. She wants to buy oil and margarine for her food making clients. This is her first loan with the institution in the three years she has been in business.

For these reasons Sara is requesting a loan to buy oil and margarine for her food making clients.

loans.use: to buy oil and margarine for her clients who cook meals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sirisia is a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya where most of the villagers suffer from poverty and malnutrition. Elizabeth is a smallholder farmer from Sirisia who has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal businesses.

The Sirisia area has a high demand for poultry products. Like many farmers from her region, Elizabeth finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farm, so she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being from a marginalized community, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging. However, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more poultry.

With the loan, she will be able to provide more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

The extra income will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children. Her adorable children mean everything to her, and she dreams that one day, when the business gets more successful, she can leave it to them so that they keep with the tradition.

You can help Elizabeth to achieve all these goals that she has, and a loan will get her closer to that.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Josselyn Abigail

texts.es:
Josselyn, está solicitando un nuevo crédito por el servicio que la institución le brinda, le servirá para comprar maíz al mayoreo, podrá ahorrar y seguir mejorando la productividad de la tortillería.
El financiamiento anterior le permitió mejorar el equipo de trabajo para elaborar tortillas y pupusas para vender, sus ingresos le permiten cancelar sus deudas y darle a sus seres queridos una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Josselyn is requesting a new loan from the lending institution. She will use it to purchase wholesale corn, which will allow her to save money and continue improving the productivity of her tortilla business. Her prior loan allowed her to improve her equipment to make tortillas and pupusas to sell. Her earnings will allow her to repay her debts and will give her loved ones a more comfortable life.

Josselyn , is requesting a new loan for the service that the institution provides , will serve to buy corn in bulk, you can save and keep improving the productivity of the tortilla . The previous funding allowed him to improve the team for making tortillas and pupusas to sell , income allow you to cancel your debts and give your loved ones a more comfortable life .

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk, so that she can save money and continue improving the productivity of her tortilla business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 51 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 25, 30 y 32 años, y su negocio es la confección de chamarra para niños. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la plaza ‘Eguino’ caracterizada por el comercio mayorista desde la madrugada hasta las 9 de la mañana.
Elsa es de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja, sus hijos son independientes y tienen sus familias, ella vive en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de chamarras para niños, ella se encarga de confeccionar chamarras por temporada, de diferentes materiales para comercializarlos por mayor, “trabajamos desde muy temprano por la madrugada, luego abandonamos el lugar para dar paso al comercio formal…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar tela por rollo. Su sueño es incrementar la producción, ella desea comprar tela por mayor para confeccionar chamarras para niños. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elsa solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar chamarras para niños.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 51 year-old married woman with three children who are 25, 30 and 32 years old. Her business is sewing children's jackets.

She is entrepreneurial, independent and very optimistic. She does business in the "Eguino" square, which is known for wholesale commerce from the early morning until 9:00 a.m.

Elsa dresses traditionally (wide-brimmed hat, shawl and pleated skirt). Her maternal language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who also works. Her children are independent and have their own families. She lives in her own home made of adobe that has all the basic services.

Her business is sewing children's jackets. She makes seasonal jackets with different materials to sell them wholesale. "We start working very early in the morning, and then vacate the place to make way for the formal businesses", she says.

The advantage of her business is that her sales are wholesale. The disadvantage is the lack of money to purchase rolls of fabric. Her dream is to increase her production. She wants to purchase fabric wholesale in order to produce children's jackets. For this reason, she is applying for the loan, which is the first loan she has applied for with the institution in the three years she has been doing this business.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric to make children's jackets.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Alice, 27 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Trans Nzoia, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and blessed with one adorable child.

Alice has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her child, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaged in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she states that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Alice's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market; this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry sales to other markets as this will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

The extra income Alice will earn will be used to fully repay the loan and permanently change her living conditions to secure the future of her school-aged child.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne's desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her young age and the obstacles she has experienced, she is not deterred in achieving her objective - what she sets out for, she gets.

Everlyne is a mother of three who has been practicing agriculture for the past five years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is known for maize plantations producing for both export and local consumption. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Everlyne. She also keeps a dairy cow.

Before joining Juhudi Kilimo, Everlyne could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Solia self-help group. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva.

Everlyne is seeking a loan to buy farm equipment. With the loan, she will be able to increase her productivity on the farm. Effective modern tools will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Everlyne waits for your kindness.

Support this great smallholder farmer who is not deterred by difficulty so that she can achieve a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment to increase productivity on her farm.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, at heart, is a resourceful, loving mum. Her motherly love has been enough to show her that she needs to work hard to help her children get ahead with excellent values and an education.

Alice, 49, is a smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. In the past 5 years, she has bred more than one dairy cow and poultry birds and has developed her farm. She has also planted and sold a variety of crops. She says the secret to her success is thinking of farming as a way to earn money, not just as a traditional way of life. Adopting new technologies and methods, crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help.

Alice was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming and some small personal business such as timber cutting. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows.

Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 5-10 liters a day, and this helps support her family. Alice also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques. Using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and, hence, increased profit levels.

Alice is visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crops than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Alice believes that through this loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Alice’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es: Cruz es una joven de 21 años de edad, habitante en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla, donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijo, y en esta misma localidad emprendió su propio negocio, un almacén misceláneo, idea de negocio sugerida por suegros quienes han sido comerciantes durante toda su vida, específicamente tenderos de víveres y abarrotes; ellos consideraron que el sector necesitaba un negocio de este formato y ella decidió seguir la intuición y las premisas de estos experimentados mercaderes. Muy motivada empezó a adquirir vitrinas y mercancías necesarias para iniciar con esta actividad, hoy en día cuenta con dos años en el negocio, ofreciendo a la comunidad una gran variedad de artículos entre ellos prendas de vestir, papelería, productos de uso personal; cosméticos, fragancias, cremas corporales y juguetería. Cruz es una mujer muy dedicada y entregada a su negocio, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana doce horas un horario muy amplio y su meta está encaminada a incrementar sus ventas, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en un nuevo surtido de productos; ropa, juguetes y productos de uso personal, que abastezcan la demanda que se aproxima por las festividades decembrinas y garanticen excelentes utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is 21 years old. She lives with her partner and child in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. This is where she started her own business, a general store, following the advice of her parents-in-law who have been grocers all their lives. They thought the area was in need of a business of this kind, and she opted to follow the intuition and premises of these experienced merchants.

With great motivation, she acquired display cases and merchandise to start the work and has by now run the business for two years. She offers the community a great variety of products for sale, including clothing, stationery, personal care items, cosmetics, fragrances, body creams, and toys. She is very committed to the business, working an extended schedule of twelve hours per day, every day.

With the goal of increasing her sales, she is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first Kiva loan. She will invest in a new selection including clothing, toys, and personal care products to meet the anticipated demand over the holidays in December. She is looking forward to excellent profits to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a new selection of products including clothing, toys, and personal care items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Mary, a 34-year-old mum who is a humble, honest and very hardworking mother on this planet Earth. Mary is a mother of seven lovely children whom she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.

Mary hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. Mary never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Mary started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

Mary practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

Mary is a mum who is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favourable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticultural products, Mary wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring mums like Mary to make their farming dreams become reality through training and loan financing.

Mary hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Mary's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market, but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Mary is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm and therefore have an impact on society.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very industrious, honest, and hardworking woman who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Mount Kenya region. She has been farming for the past 10 years. Over those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village.

Elizabeth has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. For example, she transports goods using her bicycle for a small fee.

Elizabeth is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she earns profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through the selling of cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals.

The Nkubu area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Elizabeth will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Elizabeth, but she feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Elizabeth believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals. She believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow her to repay her loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Lenders, if there is someone you should invest in, then it is Elizabeth. Support this smallholder farmer, who wants to show that the role of a mother and a farmer isn't too much for her. She just needs your vote of confidence.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Jane resides in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Jane’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She has managed to take care of her family with her income from selling different varieties of food crops. The Nkubu area has conditions that favor crop farming.

Jane has always wanted to start banana farming but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start banana farming. With this loan she will be able to harvest more bananas and hence satisfy the ready market in her region. Demand for bananas in the Nkubu area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Jane is going to comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Jane to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to be a leading supplier of bananas to major hotels and households in her region. You can be part of Jane's dreams with a loan that will help her achieve all that she wants. Help her out so that she can maintain her big smile!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start banana farming.

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
At 42 years of age, Elosy (pictured above) has gone through various circumstances and difficulties in her life. Just to mention one of them, she doesn’t have a formal job. But her courage, perseverance, and desire to succeed make her get up every day to work on her poultry business.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business.

The Chuka area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

Elosy lacks the funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will earn will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Catherine, a 42-year-old farmer from the remote village of Sikhendi, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough, because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections. Catherine lives with her lovely family on a small piece of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce.

Catherine's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Catherine made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities. Sometime this month, she applied for a loan to build a fishpond. The Sikhendi area has a ready market for fish. The only challenge is lack of supply, and through this loan she will be able to tackle the problem. The Kenya government is promoting fishpond development, because they provide a source of food from the sale of fish for small farmers and can also supply irrigation needs and water for livestock.

The additional income from the selling of fish will go to her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Catherine’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to start a fish farm by building a fishpond.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 30-year-old mother with a beautiful family. They all live in a remote town called Kitale, a place that doesn't offer the best opportunities, but this Mum has learned to deal with that. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her main sources of income have been milk, growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also has a side hustle business. Carolyne has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of her produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family," she said. Carolyne mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Carolyne is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Carolyne is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Carolyne feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Carolyne will never suffer losses due to a delay in delivery of produce to the market, and also she will increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping with the farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and ensure her children of a secure future. Help Carolyne make her dream come true; this loan can change her life.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for faster delivery of products to the market.

loans.name: Mellinah

texts.en:
Kipsaina is a typical village in the Kitale area of Kenya where people suffer from poverty and lack of capital. Most people who live in this area are smallholder farmers.

Mellinah has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past 6 years. She believes in the slogan "Unity is strength", which is why she decided to join Upendo (love) self-help group.

For the past 3 years, Mellinah has been actively involved in mixed farming. She never got the chance to get a white collar job but this has not been a setback. She has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs and implements such as fertilizers, seeds, and tools. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs, such as high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and, hence, increased profit levels.

Mellinah is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and produce more than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Rose, a 31-year-old mother who is so humble, and honest, and a very hardworking woman on this planet earth. Rose is a mother of a lovely family that she really adores so much, and will always do anything good, so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Rose hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Rose started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

Rose is a woman who is very enterprising, and she is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming on her farm. Rose wants to take advantage of the favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products, and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders, to help aspiring women like Rose make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Rose hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Her dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market, but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning, because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. If there is someone that you should trust with your $25 or more, then that person is Rose. Loan to her!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the great effort that one must put forth to progress.

Hello, Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Jane, a smallholder farmer who lives in the remote village of Kaibei in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with lovely angelic-looking children.

For the last ten years, Jane has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs, and crops, as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet.

Jane finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs. She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels.

Jane is a very hardworking woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. She will use the extra income she will receive to both repay her loan and increase her farming business

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Dorcas, one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Kitale, a remote town in Kenya. She is happily married and blessed with five lovely children. For the past 10 years, she has been engaging in mixed farming and through selling milk and a variety of food crops, she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Dorcas makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. She is seeking a loan to buy a generator that she will use to pump water from the river to her homestead. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain fed agriculture, but Dorcas wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm.

With your loan Dorcas will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity, since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. She is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders.

Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Her hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a 53 year old farmer. She is an extraordinary woman with a great personality. At a time when many farmers in Kenya are abandoning dairy farming and agriculture owing to poor yield and low income, Salina, hailing from Kapsowar, is scripting a success story with her dairy farming. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver. For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Salina has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After she lost her formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family has been overwhelming because of the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made him give up. “I have to do something for my family,"s he said.

Salina is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Salina is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Salina believes that if women smallholder farmers had the same access to resources as large scale farmers, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Cherlinda

texts.en:
Cherlinda is 29 years old and married with four children.

Cherlinda works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cherlinda has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from restaurant business.

Cherlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en:
Nazra is a 38-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her desire to fulfill her children's all necessities but her husband's income is very low. In fact he drives an auto which was not belonging to him. He wants to buy his own rickshaw but the huge cost discourages his purchasing power.

Therefore, Nazra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empower for purchasing his own rickshaw. She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until the time of their marriages. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a farm where she grows tomatoes, fruits, fish farming and also keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be diseases which affect crops.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy materials for making another greenhouse. She hopes that in the future, she will have good living conditions. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build another fish pond.

loans.use: buy materials for making another greenhouse.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda works hard to support her family. Criselda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy equipment and materials for her fishing business.

Criselda has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Criselda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials for her fishing bussiness

loans.name: Yonalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 37 years old and married with two children.

Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elvie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.I.'s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Mary (with her child in the background) is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Motosut village, who is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. She gets help with the work from her family members.

Mary is seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. Through your loan investment in her business, Mary will use the money to buy important supplies such as herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve the harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters.

Mary is optimistic that this year's harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

Be inspired; make a loan!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Introducing Ann, who is a tireless worker who works seven days a week, 12 hours per day. This is all because she wants to achieve her dream of giving her children a good education. Ann is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpments. 

Ann has been farming for the past 10 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures(a shop she runs) that help her make ends meet. 

Ann is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Ann could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Ann, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Ann believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals.
