She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Ann to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Like Ann, many smallholder women farmer await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 41-year-old mother of three who live with her family in the Trans Nzoia County, Kitale area of Kenya. Life hasn’t been easy for this hard working woman who lost her formal employment some years ago. She has had to take on the responsibility of feeding her children and family by herself because her husband also has no formal job. Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice Poultry farming for Everline was not difficult. Her parents kept poultry. For the past five years, Everline has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Everline is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Everline is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Introducing Grace! She is a tireless worker who works seven days a week, 12 hours per day. This is all because she wants to achieve her dream of giving her children a good education. Grace is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nkubu area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya.

Grace has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been bananas, milk, eggs, maize, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet.

Grace is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

Kenya's Nkubu area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Grace could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Grace, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Grace believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Grace to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Like Grace, many entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en:
Eunia is a married mother of two children. She does dairy, poultry and tree farming on her 0.2-acre piece of land.She also does some personal business(shop selling). To earn a better income, Eunia engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the 10 years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation. Given that Eunia is well connected and can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at competitive prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit.

Your loan will have two great impacts. Local farmers selling to Eunia will be freed to focus on production, rather than sales. Eunia’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood. With her positive attitude and desire to get ahead, it is evident that Eunia has an immense will to succeed, and that, of course, she will receive a favorable response to her loan request.

loans.use: to buy cereal produce

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy's young age hasn’t stopped her from fighting for her dreams. She’s a strong and hardworking woman who only is 26 years old. Mercy is very clear about what she wants and is determined to get ahead and have a good life. She is a smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Mercy owns a 2-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This mother of one, keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has five years of experience in farming.

Mercy is seeking a loan to expand with horticulture farming. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral, are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Mercy. Through a group of 15 members called Koronga, Mercy has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled.

Mercy is kindly seeking for a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of the favorable weather and road conditions she will have an easy time transporting her horticulture products to the market. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Mercy, because the institution believes that women too, are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

Mercy dreams big and wants to accomplish big things with her business and in her life. She wants to buy a new house so that her family can have a good quality life and also to pay school fees for her children. You can help Mercy with all these dreams and goals so that she can achieve them; a loan will get her so much closer.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es:
José es un orgulloso ganadero de 53 años de edad, un hombre que vive y siente el campo, heredó de su padre su pasión y los terrenos en los cuales se dedica a la cría de ganado, actividad que se ha pasado de generación en generación y la cual espera que ejerza su hija.
Es separado, se preocupa por mantener su hogar y enviar el dinero para alimentar a su hija.
José toda la vida ha tenido que convertir contra sus vecinos por vender ganado, esto se ha vuelto una verdadera guerra campal, puesto que los precios son bastante difíciles de sostener.
José pensando en ser más competitivo y no dejarse vencer y achicopalar por la competencia, quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de 4 terneras, vacunas, alimento y alimento de engorde.
Sueña con tener un gran negocio, rodeado de muchos empleados.
texts.en:
José is a 53 year old proud cattle rancher. He is a man who lives and breathes farming. He inherited his passion, as well as the cattle that he raises, from his father, a trade that has been passed on from generation to generation and that he hopes will be taken up by his daughter. He is divorced and he worries about maintaining his home and providing for his daughter. José has had to fight against his neighbors all his life to sell his cattle, which has turned into a true war since it is very difficult to maintain the prices.

In an effort to be more competitive, and not allow himself to lose and be taken over by his competition, he is seeking a loan to purchase four calfs, vaccines and feed. He dreams of having a great business with many employees.

loans.use: purchase 4 calfs, vaccines, and feed. He dreams of having a great business with many employees.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria works hard to support her family. Cesaria is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Cesaria requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Cesaria has been in this business for 10 years now.

Cesaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 56 years old, married with three children.

Lita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Lita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and buy and sell gasoline.

Lita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Nelia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like shampoo, sardines, spices, and other personal care products for her general store business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like shampoo, sardines, spices, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Letecia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 58 years old and married with five children. Lorelie works very hard to provide for them.

Lorelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Lorelie has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Lorelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Agripino

texts.es: Agripino de 60 años  es un agricultor de  hortalizas y café, lo cual realiza desde hace 30 años en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos que le ayudan en esta actividad para llevar el sustento a su casa. Él tiene una espiración en su vida y es que desea llegar a tener un negocio de compra y venta de granos básicos en su comunidad por lo cual lucha a diario para poder lograrlo. Además de eso desea para su familia la mejor condición de vida posible pero en la comunidad donde vive no cuenta con servicio  de energía eléctrica por lo que deben iluminarse con velas y lámparas de querosén afectando su salud al recibir humos tóxicos, razón por la cual Agripino ha decidido solicitar a Soluz Honduras financiamiento para la compra de un Sistema Solar y de esa manera dejar atrás  todos los inconvenientes que la falta de energía eléctrica conlleva.
texts.en:
Agripino is 60 years old. He is a vegetable and coffee farmer, an activity he has carried out for 30 years in the community of Intibucá, Honduras. He lives with his wife and two children who help him in this business to bring home their sustenance. He has an ambition in his life and that is to get to have a business buying and selling basic grains in his community and he strives each day to achieve this.

Besides this he wants the best possible living conditions for his family. But the community they live in does not have electricity. So they have to use candles and kerosene lamps for light, affecting their health breathing in the toxic fumes. For this reason Agripino has decided to request financing from Soluz Honduras to buy a solar energy system. In this way he can leave all the inconveniences behind that the lack of electricity entails.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system which will be very beneficial for his household.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a rural smallholder farmer in NKubu area of Kenya. He is married and has 5 children. Luka and his wife do livestock and crop farming for food, fodder and income. They enjoy farming for it is there means of securing the basic necessities for life. 
Luka is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest. 
The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 47 years old. She is a farmer by nature and she has worked as a manager on different farms. Today, thanks to the coming of KIVA lenders and Juhudi Kilimo to her territory, she can dream and aspire to better things for her husband and their child.

Betty is an accomplished farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She loves and cherishes her family. Betty and her husband work as a team, supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past five years. Betty often says, “I have always had an affinity for farming.” Because of the liking that she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. From her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day, and this helps her support her family.

Betty also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs; that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs and seeds. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and, therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels.

Betty is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through the lenders’ help and goodwill. Betty believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid education. This loan will be Betty’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a marvelous, good-hearted young woman who makes her living by practicing mixed farming. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future.

She makes a living doing mixed farming in the Kitale area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry for commercial milk and eggs, respectively. Besides mixed farming, Veronicah is also very concerned about the health of the environment. She spends most of her time working on her farm.

Veronicah is seeking a KES 50,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on her farm move much faster and easier. Tending to her farm involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools on the market that are handy for a woman in her line of work. The equipment does not come cheap, however.

The increase in income from this investment will go to her family's welfare and her children's education. All that remains is for her to say "thank you" to the people who are supporting her project.

Be inspired; make a loan!

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. Gregoria is married and has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Gregoria requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell to her customers.

Gregoria has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a rural smallholder farmer in the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Charles does dairy and horticultural farming for food and income.  He enjoys farming for it is his means of securing the basic necessities for life for his family. 
Charles is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest. 
The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Anna, a 40-year-old mother who is so humble and honest and a very hardworking mum on this planet Earth. Anna is a mother of four lovely children that she adores so much that she will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.

Anna hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. Anna never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Anna started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

Anna practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success.”

Anna is a mum who is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Anna wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring mums like Anna to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Anna hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions.

Anna's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. In this way, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay their tuition fees on time.

Anna is not a selfish woman and she also wants to have a positive impact on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
When speaking with Nora, it becomes obvious that she is a very dynamic, hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with her husband and their six child. She has always strived to give her children a decent life and a good education.

Nora has been in agriculture for seven years. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through her training from Juhudi Kilimo, Nora has learned about the culture of saving, and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming.

Nora has the firm intention to advance her farming business. She wants to become a successful businesswoman and ensure a better quality of life and welfare for her family. She knows that, with help from Kiva lenders and Juhudi Kilimo, she can achieve all that and more.
Lend to this enterprising Kenyan woman farmer!

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Professional Ladies Group

texts.en:
In order for circumstances or business to move smoothly without glitches there is a need for proper planning. Budgeting as a means of planning is one of the essential and most important point that Krevy of Professional Ladies captured the most when she and her group members attended Thrive sessions.
Krevy is a 36 year old woman married and is a mother of 5. She and her 3 group members of Professional Ladies reside in a well-constructed suburb of Kuwadzana Extension in the capital of Zimbabwe, Harare.
 Krevy started venturing into various businesses when she was a girl 19 years of age in 1998. By then she had a vegetables stall located along the roadside outside her parents place and also in addition to that she used to go to South Africa as a cross border trader restocking clothes and shoes and selling them in Zimbabwe. Throughout the years Krevy acquired invaluable experience on managing her business.
In 2012 Krevy ventured into hardware business selling cement, taps, water piping system, electricity cables and piping system, paint, doors and door handles. She ventured in than line of business because the margins of running a vegetable stall had dropped significantly due to the intense competition since others were entering into vegetable selling. An additional reason is that the location of Kuwadzana Extension is still being extended to accommodate more inhabitants hence a need for cement, doors, bricks and taps to build proper place to reside in. This is works to the advantage of Krevy as she is confident that her sales will be high since there is greater demand for hardware products. Krevy restocks her hardware from the central business district of Harare and she hires a carpenter who manufactures the doors according to clients’ specific order.
Krevy require a loan of $500 in order to build a proper hardware shop so that her products will not be subject to different harsh climatic conditions such as intense heat and rain. Also she intends to stock those products in bulk so as to gain discount prices.

loans.use: to build a shop to protect the cement, taps, water piping system, electricity cables and other building products she sells.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Beatrice, a 31-year-old farmer from the remote village of Kagio, situated in the central province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Beatrice's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Beatrice made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

The additional income from the expansion will go to Beatrice's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Beatrice’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an area in Kenya that is rain-fed and fertile for agriculture. He makes a living doing crop and dairy farming. Fred faces serious challenges involving transportation of his produce to the market. The bags of corn/maize are heavy to carry, he lives far from the market, transport providers' charges are based on weight and distance, poor road network, and few transport service providers. 

Fred is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably-priced motorcycle made in India for rural markets in developing countries. This motorcycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With this asset, Fred will be able to transport his produce to formal markets where he will get a fair value for his produce. Your loan investing into Fred's business will elevate his family’s livelihood and generate more income for them to meet their basic needs. Be inspired make a loan today!

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un joven soltero de 22 años de edad, trabaja como cajero. Recientemente fue diagnosticado con una enfermedad en la cornea, causa por la cual de forma progresiva ha perdido visión, la estructura de la cornea esta adoptando un forma cónica, desde la adolescencia tenía síntomas sin embargo nunca recibió atención médica, después de varios estudios él es candidato a un tratamiento quirúrgico.
Vive con sus abuelos maternos, desafortunadamente ellos no pueden apoyarlo con los gastos de la cirugía y sus ingresos no son suficientes para solventar la cirugía.
texts.en:
He is a young single man of 22 and works as a locksmith. Recently he was diagnosed with a disease of the cornea, the reason why he has been progressively losing his vision. The structure of the cornea is taking a conical shape. He has had symptoms since adolescence, however he never received treatment. After several tests he is a candidate for surgical treatment.

He lives with his maternal grandparents, unfortunately they cannot help him with the expenses of the surgery, and his income is not sufficient to pay for the surgery.

loans.use: to obtain eye treatment

loans.name: Nawungan Makmur Group

texts.en:
Madi is 60 year old farmer who lead Nawungan Makmur Group. The child in the photo is Erni's daughter and she has agreed if the child will be displayed on Kiva. They are standing in front of a cow house. Madi has a family with four children and live in a small village in Bantul, Jogjakarta, Indonesia. 

Madi strives to improve his family's economic conditions. He has a few cows to fatten and resell, and also runs the rice farming business. His business is going quite well. However, he was deeply concerned to see the high price and scarcity of non-renewable cooking gas and also seeing cow dung polluted their water canal.

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and CV. Bina Energy Mandiri Persada, (a local business enterprise – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Madi saw that biogas is the best solution of his problem. He saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non-renewable cooking gas and chemical fertilizers. He become more confident after he heard the testimony from members of Nawung Sari Group, which is also a Kiva borrower group. 

In order to make it happen, Madi invited five of his farmer friends to establish a farmer group. He is keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible. 

Madi have an optimism that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas and assist his village to become energy and food self-sufficient village.

loans.use: to build bio digester facility and utilization of bio slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Kuloba

texts.en:
Kuloba is a rural smallholder farmer in Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and has 6 children. Kuloba does dairy, poultry, horticulture and tree farming for food and income. He enjoys farming for it is his means of securing the basic necessities for life for his family.

Kuloba is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest.
The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Lydiah, a 53-year-old farmer from the remote village of Nkabune, situated in the central province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is neither clean water nor electrical connections. Lydiah lives with her lovely family on a small piece of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Lydiah's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Lydiah made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan for buying seeds to expand her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations and increase her overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to Lydiah's children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Lydiah’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Jonam

texts.en:
Jonam is a rural smallholder farmer in Nkubu area of Kenya. He is married and has 3 children. Jonam does livestock and crop farming for food and income. His wife is in the business of selling and buying livestock. The couple enjoy farming for it is there means of securing the basic necessities for life for their family.

Jonam applied for a loan to purchase agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts.
The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a rural smallholder farmer in Central Kenya. He is married and has 1 child. He does dairy and horticultural farming, catering, metal work, and electrical wiring. Farming he does to produce food, and the rest for income. He enjoys working for it is his means of securing the basic necessities for life for his family.

Stephen is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest.
The impact this loan will have on his family is increased food security and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a rural smallholder farmer in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Isaac does dairy and horticulture farming for food and income.  He enjoys farming for it is his means of securing the basic necessities for life for his family. 
Isaac is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest. 
The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy  farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es una joven soltera de 24 años de edad que está próxima a iniciar un enorme reto, esperando a cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda propia, estudiar, conformar una familia, hace poco junto recursos para alquilar el local de la foto que es un restaurante, ha realizo modificaciones, adecuaciones pero el capital aún es insuficiente, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de los insumos y enseres existentes del local, tales como ollas, cervezas, alimentos, snack, víveres entre otros, ya que se los dejan a muy buen precio.
El dinero será el último impuso que necesita Marisol para iniciar rápidamente con su local, esperando a que en un futuro poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marisol is a twenty-four year old single young woman who is about to take on a huge challenge. She hopes to achieve her dreams of having her own home, studying, and starting and family. She recently gathered the resources to rent the place in the photo which is a restaurant. She has made modifications and adjustments, but her capital isn’t sufficient.

That’s why she wants to ask for a loan which will be invested in buying supplies and equipment from the area such as pans, beer, food, and snacks among other things since she knows she can get them at a very good price. The money will be the last thing Marisol needs to quickly start her business in her neighborhood. She’s hoping that in the future she can make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to start a food-selling business

loans.name: Ma. Ena

texts.en:
Ma. Ena is 56 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Ma. Ena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Ena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Ena has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, junk foods, dis-washing liquid, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Ena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Kenya is a country that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletics. It also has a lot of smallholder farmers who work the land and raise animals. Unfortunately, the people who do this work face many problems, like the high costs of the inputs, the weather or bad seasons. Susan is aware of these issues but always finds a way to come through.

Susan is from a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya and she is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her six children as the primary caregiver. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Susan has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After her husband lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to Susan. It has been overwhelming because she now has to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said.

Susan is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 15 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Susan is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

Susan believes that if female smallholder farmers had the same access to credit facilities as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by a significant margin. Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is an ambitious woman and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of horticulture products. She's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill her dream. From Kiva lenders, Rose is seeking a loan worth 40,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Rose access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector.

With your loan, Rose’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of her family business. This will not only increase her income, but also reduce her income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds and grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Amour De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Basilwano est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, présidente du groupe de crédits «Amour de Dieu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 49 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 1 étudie et les 4 autres sont grands. Elle est propriétaire d’un dépôt relais dans une des rues de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 65 caisses de la bière Primus. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Basilwano is a retailer who cooperates with her husband. She is the president of the borrower group “Amour de Dieu” (“Love of God”), a client of IMF Hekima. She is married, forty-nine years old, and a mother of five. One of the children is in school, and the other four are grown.

She has owned a kiosk in one of the city’s streets for five years. She will purchase sixty-five cases of beer from the brand Primus. She started her business with funds received from her husband.

She wishes to increase her capital, send her children to school, and feed them. In conclusion, she wants to thank Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking systems.

loans.use: to buy 65 cases of Primus beer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven casada de 36 años de edad, trabaja en una empacadora como auxiliar administrativo. Desde los 12 años de edad le diagnosticaron miopía, hace meses que extravió sus lentes empezó con síntomas muy recurrente, desafortunadamente no ha podido graduarse otros anteojos, el especialista le recomienda un tratamiento quirúrgico para que ella pueda ver sin la necesidad de sus anteojos, ya que esto implica un gasto mayor. Lamentablemente su sueldo no le alcanza para la cirugía ya que ella apoya la economía familiar.
texts.en: She is a young married woman of 36, and works in a packing plant as an administrative assistant. When she was 12, she was diagnosed with myopia. Some months ago when she lost her glasses, she began having more recurrent symptoms, unfortunately she has not been able to get stronger glasses and the specialist is recommending a surgical treatment so that she can see without the need for her glasses, as this entails a greater expense. Unfortunately her salary is not enough for her to afford the surgery, as she is helping with the family expenses.

loans.use: to obtain eye treatment

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé est une femme âgée de 38 ans résidant à Tokoin. Mariée, Dopé vit avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Dopé est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Dopé demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des cartons de chaussures en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Dopé is a 38-year-old woman living in Tokoin. She is married and lives with her husband and two children.

Dopé is a shoe retailer who procures her merchandise twice a month at the market. She retails from home and itinerantly in neighboring areas.

Dopé is requesting this loan to make her purchase of packs of shoes. Her goal is to improve sales and turn a profit, so that she can help her husband with providing for the children’s school education and take care of some daily expenses as well.

loans.use: to buy eight packs of shoes.

loans.name: Siege De La Sagesse B Group

texts.fr: Shamavu est commerçant qui s’entraide avec son épouse, conseiller du groupe de crédits «Siege de la Sagesse B», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgé de 38 ans, marié, père de 8 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et deux sont petits. Il est  vendeur des souliers dans un magasin du centre commercial depuis 8 ans. Il va s’approvisionner en 600 paires de souliers. Il commença son business avec le capital reçu de ses parents. Il souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Shamavu is a retailer who works together with his wife. He is the advisor in the borrower group “Siege de la Sagesse B” (“Seat of Wisdom B”), a client of IMF Hekima. At thirty-eight, he is married and a father of eight. Six of the children go to school and two are too young.

He has retailed shoes in a shopping center store for eight years. He will stock up with six hundred pairs of shoes.

He started his business with capital received from his parents. He wants to purchase a plot of land, send his children to school, and feed them. In conclusion, he wants to thank Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking systems.

loans.use: to stock up with six hundred pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Juillet 2012 à l’occasion de son inauguration, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.
 
Madame Maimouna, âgée de 37 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants Elle s’active dans la vente d’habillement pour homme et femmes et accessoires aussi.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des habits pour homme et femmes d’un montant de 250 000f des accessoires à 100 000f des sacs à main des chaussures d’un montant de 125000f payer un transport aller et retour de 25000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’augmenter son activité et prendre en charges la scolarité de ses enfants et aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created and inaugurated in July 2012. The group members have good relations. Their main business is retail.

Ms. Maimouna is thirty-seven years old. She is standing all the way to the right with one hand raised. She is the group’s featured borrower. She is married and a mother of three. She works in the retail of men and women’s clothing; she also sells accessories.

With her new loan, she plans on purchase men and women’s clothes in the amount of 250,000 XOF, accessories for 100,000 XOF, handbags, and shoes for 125,000 XOF. She will also pay 25,000 XOF for return transportation to be able to retail in her own neighborhood.

Profits will allow her to grow her business and pay for her children’s school expenses. She will also help her husband manage daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy men and women's clothing for 250,000 XOF, accessories for 100,000 XOF, handbags, and shoes for 125,000 XOF.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, who is 37 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. Regina is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps goats and has a small cash-crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Regina makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Regina can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Regina’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Regina a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Paulina. She is a 33-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small rural town in central Kenya. Paulina and her husband are blessed to have two children. Paulina has been a mixed-farmer for more than four years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Paulina is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya.

Paulina is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Paulina seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nkubu and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to grow her horticulture business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a rural smallholder farmer in Nkubu area of Kenya who dearly loves animals. He is married and has six children. John does both livestock-rearing and crop farming for food and income. He enjoys working on the farm and taking care of his animals. During the loan appraisal process when the photo was taken, he said, "Farming is my means of securing the basic necessities for my family."

John is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance his farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest.

The impact this loan will have on his family is increased income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Most people in Africa dream of getting a good education and a well-paying job but this has not been the case for Mercy. Her highest education level is primary school and she has never succeeded in getting employment. Despite all these adversities she picked herself up and she has been farming for the past 10 years. She decided that she will be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. Mercy has a husband, and has been blessed with four lovely children that she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are crops, dairy goat milk and cow, poultry.

She is seeking a loan, with which she plans to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when she was asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been so high that she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing her farm's milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk per day. This will immediately translate to a higher profit margin and increased income level. Mercy will use profits from selling milk to paying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Mercy is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling. In addition, she plans to start selling other dairy products, such as cream. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future.
Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a high-quality breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Purity practices mixed farming. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed animals on her farm. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. Although Purity has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to be able to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Purity will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Purity will reap more, which will assure her of comfort taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Purity's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out and keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs which will increase her yield and enable her to buy more land.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Her desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her age and the obstacles she has experienced, she doesn't reduce her efforts to achieve her objective - what she sets out for she gets. She is so humble and honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Caroline is the mother of lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good for so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.

Caroline hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Caroline started farming and has been doing farming for the past five years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Caroline practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

Caroline is a woman who is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Caroline wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Caroline to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing.

Caroline hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Caroline's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets by exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Caroline is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society and that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

Help this woman with dreams and goals to realize. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has 3 children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, horticulture and tree farming to provide for her family. In the Nkubu area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Nkubu can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Joyce is seeking a 40,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.
You can help Joyce with all these dreams and goals so she can achieve them all; a loan will get her so much closer.

loans.use: to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity.

loans.name: Frinda

texts.en:
Frinda is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. She has been practicing farming for the past ten years.

Frinda has always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in her blood. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day; this helps her support her family. Frinda also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Frinda is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. Frinda believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Frinda's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Janice, 53 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in kaururu, a remote village in Nkubu. She is happily married and has 6 children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.
Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Los Invencibles Group

texts.es:
Katherin Continúa con su negocio de venta de gaseosas. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando sombrillas para cubrirse del sol, sillas y refrescos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio tuvo buenas ventas(LA SEÑORA QUE OCUPA EN CARGO DE PRESIDENTA ES LA Q ESTA EN LA PARTE DERECHA, LA SEÑORA VISTE CON UNA POLERA VERDE ENTERA Y UN PANTALON COLOR CAFE). Actualmente su negocio continua generando mejores ingresos y la necesidad constante es la de contar con refrescos a la venta, “los refrescos ocupan mucho espacio por eso debo reponerlos a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la mercadería rota diariamente, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar refrescos por mayor. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella dese comprar gaseosas por mayor para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Katherin solicita un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Katherin is continuing with her business selling soft drinks.  She used her previous loan to buy umbrellas to provide coverage from the sun, and chairs and drinks.  She paid her loan off on time, because her business had good sales.  (She is the president of this communal bank, and is seen in the photo on the right wearing a green shirt and tan pants).  At this time, Katherin's business is continuing to generate good income, and she needs to have drinks to sell.  "The drinks take up a lot of space, and so this is why I have to replace them daily," she comments.  

The advantage of Katherin's business is that the merchandise turns over daily, the disadvantage is that she lacks the money to buy drinks at wholesale.  Her dream is to have a stable business.  She wants to buy soft drinks at wholesale to stock up her business.  This is her 2nd loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she has been developing her independent business.

This is why Katherin is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks at wholesale to stock up her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is noe borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Viola dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de admirar, una persona humilde, pero trabajadora que inicio un negocio de confección en el año 2012 y con perseverancia, respeto y cumplimento en los tiempos de entrega se ha consolidado en el mercado, ahora goza de buen volumen de trabajo, incluso logró comprar un vehículo para entregar todos los pedidos y de paso generar un empleo, también usa el vehículo para entregar pedidos externo a su negocio, siendo este un valor agregado.
Rosa gusta mucho de ahorrar, le gusta mantener sus cuentas al día.
Actualmente necesita un apoyo económico para reparar el vehículo y seguir con ese ingreso extra que tanto le ha ayudado en las temporadas frías.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman to admire: a humble but hard-working person who began her sewing business in 2012.  With perseverance, respect, and observance of her delivery times, she has established herself in the market.  She now enjoys a good volume of work and even managed to buy a vehicle to deliver all her orders and create an employment opportunity.  As an added bonus, she also uses the vehicle to deliver orders aside from her business.

Rosa takes pleasure in saving; she likes to keep her accounts up to date.

Currently she needs some financial support to fix her vehicle and keep going with this extra income which has helped her so much through cold spells.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used for transporting her merchandise

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Aileen a young farmer from Nkubu in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Aileen is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Aileen passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nkubu and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business.

The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nkubu and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. Aileen has been practicing agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training. There is no doubt that through your loan Aileen's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael, 24, is a loving mom and a hardworking farmer, committed to building a better life for her family. Rael is a go-getter and she hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya, a rural town in the Rift valley area of Kenya. She and her husband support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her child.

Although this humble mom has been making profits, not everything has been easy. She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Nandihills area has a ready market for cereal, she is seeking a loan to buy cereal to be able to improve her income level. Rael’s upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mom has been making great improvements. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Rael has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Rael is visionary and hopes that with the profits, she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

You can help Rael to accomplish this. A little trust and a loan will make a big difference in her and her family's lives.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en: Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Vibian, 31, who is based in the Eldoret area of Kenya and is a mother of two lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming and personal business, and through these ventures she has been able to make ends meet. Vibian and her family live in the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities. Vibian is very enterprising, and through farming, she has been able to support her family, although she has been facing challenges. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm equipment to help her produce more. With the loan, Vibian will be able to turn around her life because the production level on her farm will increase, and this means more income. Through the loan, she will be able to improve her family's living standards.  She is confident that the new profits will allow her to repay the loan comfortably. Vibian intends to purchase more land through the savings that she will make, and this will ensure her family has a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 42 years old and has five children. Merlyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Merlyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Merlyn has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Annrita

texts.en: Annrita is an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. She resides in Mathiamene, a remote village in the lush hills of Nkubu, in the central area of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family with two children, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Because of her immense farming knowledge, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and bananas. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereal; the only challenge she faces is lack of funds. She is requesting a loan to buy cereal. She intends to buy different varieties of cereal to sell in the local market. The market for cereal is never a problem because the demand is high, and she plans to take advantage of that. Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. Annrita is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. Through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. With this loan, Annrita’s life will take a positive turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of four from Nandihills, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Mary is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she is involved in; poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed them.

Mary wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but her biggest challenge is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With the loan, Mary will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Mary is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Mary dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Nalea

texts.en:
Nalea is a woman who is eager to get ahead. She is a 51-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is blessed with a lovely family, which is her greatest motivation in life because she wants to provide them with a better future. Nalea was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 5 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living. She has space there to use for dairy farming and a side motorbike business.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Chuka is an area that has a large population and there is a big demand for milk. Nalea, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved. With this loan, she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

Nalea has many dreams, and because her children are so important to her, she wants to give to all of them the best education she can. She also would like to improve the conditions of her house. You can be part of Nalea's dreams with a loan that will help her achieve all that she wants.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Jecinta, a young farmer from Nandi County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Jecinta is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Her primary sources of income have been from planting milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet. Jecinta passionately loves farming. She got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security which remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nandihills and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she faces is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal. Demand for cereal is overwhelming in Nandihills and through this loan, she will buy different varieties of cereal. This will help her satisfy the demand in her village and local market. With this loan, Jecinta will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereal. Jecinta has been practicing agriculture with youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will grow in leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through this loan, Jecinta's life will change permanently. It will ensure her school-going children have a secure future.

You can help Jecinta to accomplish all her dreams, and a loan will do that for her.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Union Y Fuerza Group

texts.es:
Adda continúa con su negocio de sastrería(segunda de la izquierda, viste polera sin mangas azul). El crédito anterior lo ocupo comprando tela por rollo. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque sus ventas mejoraron. Actualmente su negocio cuenta con pedidos que realiza por menor y mayor, “tengo la necesidad continua de comprar tela…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar tela, hilos y otros materiales. Su sueño es tener un taller amplio en su casa, ella desea comprar de tela por rollo para confeccionar vestidos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 28 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adda solicita un préstamo para comprar de tela por rollo para confeccionar vestidos.
texts.en:
Adda is continuing with her dressmaking business.  (In the photo, she is second from the left, wearing a sleeveless blue shirt.)  With her previous loan, she bought rolls of fabric.  She made her payments on time because her sales were increasing.  Now her business has outstanding retail and wholesale orders.  "I need to continue to buy fabric," she states.  

The advantage of Adda's business is that she has reliable orders, the disadvantage is that she lacks the money to buy fabric, thread, and other materials.  Adda's dream is to have a big workshop in her house.  She wants to buy fabric by the roll to make dresses.  This is her 2nd loan with the institution in the 28 years she has been devoted to this activity.

This is why Adda is requesting a loan to buy fabric by the roll to make dresses.

loans.use: to buy fabric by the roll to make dresses

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 61 years old and lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with six children who are her greatest motivators. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Alice was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation in her family. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

Alice has always had an affinity for farming. She has even nicknamed one of her cows and is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day which helps her support her family. Alice also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high-quality seed, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profits.

Alice is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Alice believes that through the loan, she will be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will lift Alice out of poverty.

Make a $25 loan or more, and push this granny's dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as good quality seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 35 years of age. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband.

Sally has been characterized by her neighbors and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began five years ago.

Sally, tired of working just to survive, wishes to request a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Sally’s family, and a commodity for trade.

Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers like Sally to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.
With your support, this mum will be able to fulfill her dreams. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is kind-hearted, well-organized, honest, industrious and entrepreneurial. She is a mother who makes sure her three children never go to bed hungry. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya. Lucy never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Lucy has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and learned important farming techniques. Lucy practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education. Lucy believes that education is the only key to success.

She is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to buy seed and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Lucy wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Lucy to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Lucy hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Lucy's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables.
