Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Lucy is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for on her horticulture farm and have an impact on society.

Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Virginia, a 38-year-old mother who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Virginia is a mother of three lovely children who she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.

Virginia hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. Virginia never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Virginia started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips.

Virginia practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the “key to success.”

Virginia is a woman who is very enterprising, and she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Virginia wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Virginia to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Virginia hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions. Virginia's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables.

Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Virginia is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society; that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es:
Aníbal es un agricultor de 40 años de edad, padre de dos hijos de 3 y 8 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja en el municipio de Marinilla y se dedica a actividades agrícolas.
En el momento el señor Aníbal busca salvar sus cultivos, para ello necesita riegos e insumos agrícolas como abonos, pesticidas, insecticidas y fungicidas, peor no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar dichos insumos que actualmente tiene un precio elevado, por ello solicita un préstamo para completar el dinero necesario y así poder seguir trabajando por su sueño que es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Anibal is a 40 year-old farmer who is the father of 2 children aged 3 and 8.  He is in a common-law marriage, and he lives with his partner in the municipality of Marinilla.  He works in agriculture.

At this time, Anibal is seeking to save his crops.  To do this he needs irrigation and agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, and fungicides.  However, he lacks the funds to buy these supplies, which are currently selling for a high price.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan so that he can gather together the funds he needs to continue working toward his dream of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Most of the Kenyan people find an opportunity to make a living and progress through practicing mixed farming. Such is the case of Damaris who, at the age of 53, has a small parcel of land. Damaris is a very hardworking, very honest and warmhearted farmer who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth for farming. 

Damaris is the proud mother of a lovely family whom she adores and always protects. Damaris' upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Damaris is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Damaris is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Damaris is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Damaris will assure her children a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

For Damaris, nothing is impossible. She wants to continue working to fulfill her dream of becoming the largest horticulture farmer so that she can enjoy a good quality life. Kindly make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Juster

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Juster, a 61-year-old mother of one child, who resides in the Nkubu area in Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. Juster has been practicing farming for the last three years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. 

Juster enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improves her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. 

Having the traits of a go-getter, Juster has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to start the shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Juster will be able to improve her income level and comfortably take care of her family. 

Juster’s projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her child and husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals and start a cereal-selling shop.

loans.name: Los Amigos X Siempre Group

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de sastrería (sentada al centro, viste polera verde). El crédito que obtuvo lo empleó comprando una máquina de coser industrial y cortes de tela, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente se especializa en arreglar prenda de vestir, como; largo de pantalón, ancho de cintura, ancho de espalda y otros, “continúo trabajando en 2 actividades, necesito tela para continuar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes que compran por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar tela por mayor. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura completo, ella desea comprar tela por rollo. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para su negocio de confección.
texts.en:
Maria will continue her tailoring and sewing business (she’s seated in the center wearing a green shirt). She used the previous loan she received to buy an industrial sewing machine and bolts of cloth; she made her payments on time. Currently, she specializes in tailoring garments such as the length of pants, the width of waists, and the width of backs among other things. She says, “I’ll continue working two jobs (tailoring and making clothes). I need cloth to continue.”

The advantage of her business is that she has customers who buy wholesale. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy cloth wholesale. Her dream is to have a complete sewing workshop, so she wants to buy cloth by the roll. This is her third cycle of loans with the institution, and for fifteen years she has done both types of work.

It’s for these reasons that Maria is asking for a loan to buy cloth by the roll for her tailoring and sewing business.

loans.use: to buy cloth by the roll for her tailoring and sewing business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Ella es María es una mujer de 24 años de edad que vive en unión libre con su pareja, ella es una persona trabajadora que no le gusta quedarse en su hogar esperando que la mantenga, pero por el momento no puede trabajar ya que tiene un pequeño de 10 meses de edad del cual hacerse cargo, por tal motivo optó por la opción de convertiré en emprendedora y montar un almacén de ropa y accesorios.
Ella ha hecho todo lo posible por juntar el dinero necesario, ha comprado varios artículos, consiguió el local, pago la renta, ha comprado estanterías pero aún le resta lo más importante que es la mercancía, por ello quiere acudir a un apoyo económico que usara en la compra de ropa para hombre y dama y accesorios, la principal razón de montar el negocio es para tener una actividad productiva, mejorar sus ingresos y estar cerca de su hijo.
texts.en:
This is María. She is 24 years old and lives with her partner. She is a hard working person who does not like to stay at home waiting for someone to look after her. However she cannot work at the moment because she has a 10 month old that she looks after. For this reason she decided to turn herself into an entrepreneur and open a clothes and accessories store.
She has done everything possible to gather the necessary money, she has bought various items, got the premises, pays the rent, has bought the shelves but all that she is missing is the most important thing, the merchandise. This is why she wants to apply for financial help that she will use to buy clothes for men and women and accessories. The main reason for starting her own business is to have productive work, increase her income and be close to her child.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothes.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in a humble home in the town of Nkubu, along with her husband and their three children. She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity.

With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Rael and her family

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline sells crops from her small farm and keeps dairy cows and poultry.

Magdaline is seeking a loan worth 40,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment, Juhudi has teamed with Kiva to give Magdaline access to a loan that will help her farm grow into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. Magdaline’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds and grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.en:
Generally Filipinos are capable of handling life’s many adversities well. They are like bamboo trees which are bent but not broken, drawing strength and inspiration from solidarity and togetherness.

Maria Gloria, 56, is a widow with three children who are now grown-up. Raising her children alone was a challenging task for her but she didn’t give in to hardship and poverty. She didn’t consider her children as a heavy burden and responsibility, but instead she sees them as companions in her life journey. Now she’s also blessed with grandchildren. They continuously give her inspiration and strength to work hard. She also finds encouragement from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative, through their inspiring stories and Bible reflections.

Maria Gloria gets additional sustenance from selling frozen foods such as hotdogs, sausages, ham, marinated meat and dressed chickens. As she continues to develop her business, she needs additional capital of PHP 17,000 to buy more supplies for her store and additional frozen foods to sell. Your generous assistance will surely give her a little comfort. Thank you so much in advance.

She dreams of a successful life and career for her children and grandchildren. She also longs to renovate her house which has deteriorated so much due to numerous typhoons that hit their area.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store and additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Remberto Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre con 30 años de edad y vive en el municipio de Sincelejo. El año pasado decidió emprender su propio negocio para criar cerdos. Él quiere mejorar su negocio mediante el aumento de sus ventas, siendo más competitivo, y tener un negocio sostenible. Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de cerdos, vacunas y cuido para los mismos y también hará unas reparaciones a unas marraneras que tiene sin uso.
Para este hombre trabajador no hay nada imposible, quiere seguir luchando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, preste hoy!
texts.en:
Carlos is a thirty-year-old man who lives in Sincelejo Municipality. Last year, he decided to start his own business raising pigs. He wants to improve his business by increasing his sales, becoming more competitive, and having a sustainable business. He is asking for a loan to invest in buying pigs, purchasing vaccines, and caring for them; he also wants to repair some of the pens that he hasn’t used.

For this hardworking man, nothing is impossible. He wants to continue working until he has achieved his dream of having his own home.

With your contribution, this man will be able to make his dreams a reality. So go ahead, please give today!

loans.use: to buy pigs, purchase vaccines, and care for them; he will also repair some of the pens.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is one of the hardest-working women on planet earth; she is a go-getter from Togitie a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Charity has defied all the odds and has farmed for five years.

Charity is content with the farming way of life and is a very enterprising woman. She hasn't had formal employment but always worked hard on her farm to provide her children and family with decent meals. The Nkubu area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming which is why she seeks a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Charity feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women. Please help Charity so that her horticulture farm can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is happily married, and together with his wife, they are blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years Geoffrey has been involved in mixed farming. He has identified free space on his farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices have been going up in the recent past, so Geoffrey, being a visionary and entrepreneurial farmer, wants to take full advantage of this.

He has chosen the breed of cow that he will keep, and he knows that he will get not only milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of his farm. Selling his milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and he will also be selling to big dairy processing firms.

He underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Geoffrey hopes that through the accumulated profit he will be able to add value to his milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change his life and will secure the future of his children and aging parents.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Karen Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es una joven de 23 años de edad, una joven visionaria, con gran talento, tiene un café bar que constituyo con su propio esfuerzo, ahora se proyecta a mejorar su negocio, tener nuevos servicios y bebidas para satisfacer y fidelizar a sus clientes.
Melissa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una máquina para preparar granizados, comprar un puesto de shots, con sus respectivos implementos y surtido inicial de licor para preparar los granizados.
Su meta es ser una empresaria exitosa, ayudar a su familia y no pasar nunca necesidades.
texts.en:
Melissa is 23 year old young lady. She is a visionary, with great talent. She has a coffee bar that she built with her own effort. She now plans to improve her business, to offer new services and drinks to satisfy, and build loyalty with, her customers.

Melissa wants to seek a loan to buy a machine to make iced drinks, to buy a shot station with its respective parts and an initial supply of liqueur for making iced drinks. Her goal is to be a successful businesswoman, and to help her family and never suffer hardships.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make iced drinks, liqueurs and parts.

loans.name: Leidy Liliana

texts.es: Leidy es una mujer activa y competente que se dedica a la venta de mercancía, como calzado y productos de uso personal, actividad que inicio por necesidad económica y por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, vive en unión libre con su pareja, trabaja por tener una mejor vida, por ello es arriesgada, quiere darlo todo por su negocio, por eso hoy está ante ustedes solicitando una ayuda, para crecer, para fortalecerse, para ser competitiva, para hacer de su negocio un éxito total, dicho monto de capital lo invertirá en la compra de surtido de calzado crocs y tenis lacoste, accesorios en acero y campo de estantes.
texts.en:
Leidy is an active and competent woman who is engaged in the sale of goods, such as shoes and personal products. She started this activity out of financial necessity and choice, and a desire to work independently. She lives in union with her partner, works to have a better life, take a risk, and give her all to her business.

This is why she is before you today asking for support, to grow, become stronger, more competitive, to make her business a success. The principal amount will be invested in the purchase of footwear, accessories, and shelves.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of footwear, tennis shoes, accessories, and shelves.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, aged 54, is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming.

Sarah practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. Although Sarah has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education.
You can help this hard worker mother to accomplish all her dreams, a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand her horticulture business.

loans.name: Carlos Ramón

texts.es: Carlos es habitante de un barrio popular en Barranquilla un municipio de la costa Atlántica, en donde la comunidad es muy abierta a la diversión y el baile,  y en su vivienda Carlos posee un equipo de sonido que lo usaban los fines de semana para escuchar música tradicional y su vecindad disfrutaba de ella. Su cónyuge, siempre había querido tener un negocio y le propuso iniciar una venta de cervezas y refrescos en su vivienda, aprovechando la captación de clientes que atraía la música los fines de semana, de este modo compraron un enfriador con gran capacidad para preservar cervezas, gaseosas, pony maltas, jugos naturales y bolis de frutas.   En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar canastas de cervezas y refrescos para aprovisionarse, puesto que en el último trimestre del año sus ventas se incrementan. Carlos desea continuar en su negocio y engrandecerlo para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a resident of a working-class neighborhood in Barranquilla, a town on the Atlantic coast, where the community is very open to entertainment and dance. In his home, Carlos has a sound system that he used on weekends to listen to traditional music, and his neighborhood enjoyed it. His wife had always wanted to start a business, and proposed that they begin to sell beers and soft drinks in their home, capitalizing on the collection of customers attracted by the music on the weekends. So they bought a refrigerator with a large capacity to store beers, soft drinks, Pony Maltas (a popular malt soft drink), natural juices and fruit ice pops.

Currently he is applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan financed through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy cases of beer and soft drinks to stock up, given that in the last trimester of the year, his sales increase. Carlos hopes to continue his business and expand it in order to offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Rosa, una mujer alegre, humilde, trabajadora, una persona de 67 años de edad que diariamente se levanta a elaborar alimentos, ella es soltera, tiene una hija, se siente orgullosa de ser autosuficiente y tener salud para trabajar.
Rosa tiene un propósito para trabajar, el cual es, vivir una vejez digna, sin pasar necesidades, sin tener que pedir dinero a nadie, por ello hace todo lo posible por crecer, por mantenerse, por satisfacer sus clientes, además que necesita mucho de las utilidades para pagar las cuentas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos con los que preparara comidas saladas, también necesita platos y vasos desechables.
texts.en: This is Rosa, a happy, humble, hardworking, 67 year old woman.  She gets up every day to make food.  She is single, has one daughter, and feels proud that she is self-sufficient and is healthy enough to work.  Rosa has a reason to work, which is to live her later years in dignity, without hardship, and without having to ask for money from anyone.  For that reason she does everything possible to grow, maintain herself and satisfy her customers.  In addition, she really needs the income to pay the bills.  She seeks a loan to buy supplies with which she will prepare savory dishes.  She also needs plates and disposable cups.

loans.use: to buy supplies with which she will prepare savory dishes, plates and disposable cups.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Susan, a very hardworking mother who is 29 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Kipsaina, a remote village in the fertile highlands of the Kitale area of Kenya. This charming mother of seven has been engaged in mixed farming for the past five years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main sources of income have been eggs, milk, maize, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby.

Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kitale region. Susan has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. Being a visionary woman, Susan has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Susan will achieve their dreams and goals.

Susan believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers, which are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Él es Eliseo un hombre del campo, trabajador, honesto, dedicado a su familia y a su cría de pollos, actividad con la que genera el sustento para su familia, un trabajo difícil de mantener, debido a la fuerte competencia, el bajo precio de venta del pollo, los altos costos de insumos para mantenerlos en óptimas condiciones, estos motivos, son por los cuales el señor Eliseo quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para formalizar, mejorar y mantener su negocio.
Dicho dinero será invertido de la siguiente manera:
•	Construcción de un galpón para ingresar como mínimo 50 gallinas, comprar las gallinas, alimento, vacunas y vitaminas para los animales.
texts.en:
Eliseo is a farmer. He is hard-working, honest and devoted to his family and to raise chickens. He supports his family with this activity. This is a hard trade because there's a lot of competition, sale prices are low and provision prices are high if you want to keep your animals is prime condition. For these reasons, Eliseo wants to ask for financial support to establish, improve and maintain his business.
He wil use this loan for the following: to build a coop that can host at least 50 chickens, to buy those chickens, as well as feed, vaccines and vitamins for the animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, vaccines and to build a coop of the animals

loans.name: Lina Alexandra

texts.es:
Un impulso económico es lo que necesita la joven Lina para iniciar su venta de mercancía como calzado y accesorios como bisutería, ella en el momento se encuentra solicitando un crédito, el cual usara en la compra de los productos anteriormente mencionado.
Este esfuerzo, estas ganas tiene un motivo, su pequeña que tan solo tiene 6 meses de edad, ella quiere trabajar y ser autosuficiente, poder brindarle una excelente educación, un hogar propio, una familia amorosa, asegurarle un futuro y debido a que ha tenido problemas para encontrar empleo fijo, decidio montar un negocio en el cual pueda generar empleo, alegrías y afianzarse económicamente.
Vamos anímate, apoya a la empresaria.
texts.en:
Lina needs a financial boost to start selling merchanzise such as shoes and accessories, like jewelry. She is asking for a loan to buy these products.
All her efforts have a reason. She has a daughter that's only 6 years old, so Lina wants to work and become self-suficient, to provide her daughter with an excellent education, a home of their own, a loving family, and to provide for her future. She's had trouble finding a steady job, so she decided to set up this business and generate her own income, feel happier and become financially stronger. Come on, go ahead and support this business woman.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes and accessories to start her business.

loans.name: Lisper

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lisper, a mother of two from Rukaini, a rural village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Lisper has been involved in farming for 14 years! Her primary income sources are milk, crops, eggs and other personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable but also enjoyable; all the animals on her farm are referred to by names. The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital.

Lisper is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry is a big business if made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point. Invest in Lisper’s future. The income she will generate from her poultry farm alone is enough to facilitate timely loan repayments and savings. The loan will help Lisper’s family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Rehema, who is a 27-year-old smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Rehema owns a one-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The mother of five keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has seven years of experience in farming.

Rehema is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Rehema. Through a group of 12 members called Anganza, Rehema has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which uses the group-based savings as collateral.

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity to reduce poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Rehema because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: To expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Stella (holding her child in the above picture), a young farmer from the Nandihills area of Kenya, who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture.

Stella is the proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some varieties of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Stella passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nandihills and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local markets.

With your loan, Stella will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Stella has been practicing agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through your loan Stella's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future. Loan to her today!

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Nervios, ansiedad, felicidad, son algunos de los sentimientos que tiene la señora Lina, una mujer responsable, luchadora y sobresaliente que hoy busca un apoyo económico para Iniciar su negocio de Ebanistería, la principal razón es que busca generar buenos recursos para mantener a su familia y no se ve toda la vida trabajando para alguien, sus aspiraciones es ser jefe, generar empleo, más no ser empleada.
Por estos motivos Lina quiere que la apoyen en su proyecto que quizás será, su proyecto de vida, el dinero será utilizado para la compra de herramienta de mano, maquinaria, insumos y adecuación de un local.
texts.en:
Nerves, anxiety and happiness are some of the feelings that Lina has. She is a responsible, hardworking, outstanding woman who today seeks economic support to begin her business of cabinetmaking. The primary reason for this is that she seeks to generate good resources to maintain her family, and to not spend her whole life working for someone. Her aspirations are to be the boss, and to generate employment, rather than to be an employee.

For these reasons, Lina wants to be supported in her project, that might be the project of her life. The money will be used to buy hand tools, machinery and supplies, and to adapt a locale.

loans.use: to buy hand tools, machinery and supplies and to adapt a locale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Catherine started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kirege, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Catherine believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Catherine waits for your kindness..

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy barbed wire

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 41 years old, married, and has been blessed with a beautiful family. She is a farmer from Tendurwa village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She is dedicated to her work and only thinks about going forward and delivering good products. She knows that many people consume her products, and because of this, she is determined that her products be pure and of good quality.

Regina lives on a small piece of land where she keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her primary sources of income are milk and horticultural produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Regina joined Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Regina requested a loan, which she will use to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. This loan will enable her to expand her operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go toward her children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, children are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With this loan, Regina's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty and the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her children are some of the reasons that made Catherine start practicing mixed farming. Catherine is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. She is based in Mayanja, a remote village in the Bungoma area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy and maize farming. The region's staple food is “Ugali”, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from maize.

Catherine’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Bungoma area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income. Catherine’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Catherine has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Catherine is quite visionary and, with her accumulated profits, hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

You can help Catherine to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Speaking with Rose, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

Rose has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, as well as milk, eggs, and crops. She also has a side hustle business (motorbike business). She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity. Rose is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards.

Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Rose and her family. With your help Rose will be able to fulfill her dreams.

Go ahead, make a loan and keep her big smile!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with three children who are her greatest motivation in life. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Irine was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

Irine has always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in her blood. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her dairy cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day; this helps her support her family. Irine also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Irine is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year and also build a modern house. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Irine believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Irine's way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Joan, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 38-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family, with a husband and six children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Siongiroi, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 10 years she has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and selling crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming.

Joan passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy unit will assist Joan in managing her cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions.

Before Joan joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, she considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Joan now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a less rough way into the “millionaires club." With the loan, Joan will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Joan will achieve this. Through the modern dairy unit, Joan will have a comfortable time milking her cow. Also, her cow will never be affected with diseases that are associated with being exposed to harsh weather conditions.

An increase in income will allow Joan to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Joan fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

You can help Joan to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty and the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her two children are some of the reasons that made Elizabeth start practicing mixed farming. Elizabeth is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. She is based in Simat, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy and crop farming. The region's staple food is mursik, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk.

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Elizabeth. Through a group of 15 members called Kipkenyo self-help group, Elizabeth has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral.

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Because of the favorable weather and road conditions, she will have an easy time transporting her horticulture products to the market.

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Elizabeth because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. Her main dream is to buy a house and pay for the education of her children.

You can be part of this dream. Go for it! Make a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, microfinance institutions (M.F.I.s) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Emmy, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 41 years of age. She hails from the Siongiroi area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of four lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable.

Emmy’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been a bed of roses. She faces financial challenges, and because the Siongiroi area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Emmy’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Emmy has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Emmy is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Banana farming is something that is more of a passion for Hellen than a business. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2010. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Mitine, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of two lovely children. For the past five years she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling bananas, milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. Hellen passionately loves banana farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan which she paid back fully. She also benefited from training. The impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated.

Hellen is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy more banana seeds so that she can plant more banana trees. The banana seeds she plans to buy are not just ordinary banana seeds; they are quality seeds. Bananas cost more money. With this loan she will get a lot of profits and also satisfy the demand is in her village for bananas. From this loan, the life of Hellen will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Hellen waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy banana seeds.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 27-year-old farmer from a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells dairy and goat milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, and sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Everlyne will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic 55-year-old woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began 10 years ago. This year, Julia celebrates her 16th year in marriage with Biwot, the father of her four children. To support Biwot in providing for their family, Julia started farming. Today, her three-acre farm holds three dairy cows, poultry, and a field of maize/corn.

Julia is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food for Julia’s family, and a commodity for trade. Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Julia, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting and feeding her family.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Charity, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nkubu area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. Charity, 46, has been farming for the past 20 years. Through these years, she has gathered a lot of experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Charity is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them, and then once the crops are ready for harvest she can sell them. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy seeds for planting.

Kenya's Nkubu area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for crop produce. This means that Charity could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Charity, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Charity believes that this loan will be a lot of help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for crops. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Charity to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children. Loan to her today so that you can keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is the mother of four lovely children and is a very hardworking woman. She is based in Kapleu, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is mursik, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. Christine has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Selling eggs and milk has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. Christine passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She wakes up every morning to milk her cows. While this humble mom has been making a profit by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best-quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk.

Christine is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions. You can help Christine to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Gulshair

texts.ru: Гулшаир, 49 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1988 году. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гулшаир, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 2 коровы, 7 овец, 6 лошадей. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 0,60 Га и арендованной мерой 0,40 Га она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулшаир обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 2 коров. Гулшаир намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что приведет к получению большей совокупной прибыли от перепродажи скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulshair is 49 years old, married and the mother of two. She has received secondary education. As a source of income for her family, she grows farm crops and raises livestock, having launched this business in 1988. Thanks to Gulshair's persistence and hard work, at present she owns two cows, seven sheep, and six horses. She also grows barley on her own field of 0.6 ha [1.5 acres] and a leased field of 0.4 ha [1 acre]. 

In order to develop her business further, Gulshair has applied to the Bai Tushum Bank for a loan in the amount of 70,000 soms (KGS) to buy two cows. Gulshair intends to increase her livestock, which will lead to an increase of her total revenues from animal sales. She plans to invest the revenues from this loan into further business growth.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a mother dedicated to her work. At age 42, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, in her mixed farm, tirelessly working. Purity is one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Karumathi, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married to Nicholas, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three lovely children. For the past five years she has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Purity makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Purity comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this precious commodity. Purity faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health. Purity is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Purity wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan, Purity will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Purity is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Purity’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, a youthful 41-year-old farmer from Maguti, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver.

The living conditions in the Nyamira area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Lilian has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Lilian started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. Her sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market.

The Nyamira area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Lilian is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Lilian is very determined to succeed. Because she is very disciplined with finances, she plans to be able to provide a secure future for herself and for her children through accumulated profits. Lilian’s dream is to provide a secure future for her children by paying tuition fees for them. You will help her realize her dream through your loan. Contribute to this mum's life, grant her a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her products to the market in a timely manner

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys was inspired to improve her farming business when her friends told her about Juhudi Kilimo and the partnership they have with Kiva to support marginalized women smallholder farmers. Juhudi Kilimo was established with a mission to uplift, empower, and validate women across Kenya. Gladys is a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her parents. Gladys lives near Kiabiraa in the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming.

Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat ugali (hard porridge cooked from maize). One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Kiabiraa area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Gladys intends to change this by buying another electric posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully breakdowns will be few and far between.

To accomplish this, Gladys is applying for a 100,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Gladys sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. Gladys has many dreams, but like the mother she is, she wants the best for her three children. Therefore, she wants to pay for a good education for them. You can help this responsible woman to accomplish her dreams with a loan. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an electric posho mill.

loans.name: Sitera

texts.en:
Whether large scale or small scale, farming continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is also the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product. Sitera, 42, started farming approximately six years ago, and although she began farming as a hobby, it eventually became her career. Her five-acres of land located in the Nyamira area of Kenya house poultry and dairy cows. Sitera passionately loves poultry farming. The Nyamira area is populated, and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Sitera’s biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry.

Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Sitera will be able to sell eggs, meat, and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in her area.

Sitera has been facing challenges accessing finances, but she feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make her dream come true. Sitera chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low, and is on a reducing basis. Sitera underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions.

Through the loan, Sitera's income will increase and her life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for her family and a positive impact to the community. Sitera dreams big and wants to accomplish big things with her business and in her life. You can help Sitera with all these dreams and goals so she can achieve them all; a loan will get her so much closer.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Nearly all the people in the Litein area are farmers and Roda is one of them. Roda is a mixed farmer based in Tebesonil, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Roda is a proud mother of four lovely, school-going children, whom she truly loves and greatly adores. Roda describes her upbringing as challenging, so she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her children and to help secure their future.

Roda is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the KES 20,000 (Kenya shillings) loan, she is going to pay for a truckload of manure and also pay for seedlings.

Roda has been farming for nearly one decade. She is going to use your loan investment and the years of experience she has gathered, to make this expansion a success. Money gathered from this investment will enable Roda to contribute to her family's general expenses, her children's education, and medical needs.

Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Jader Manuel

texts.es:
Jader es un joven de 23 años de edad, padre de familia responsable y alegre que hoy quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para ampliar su negocio de venta de cría y venta de aves, este joven a pesar de ser del campo es visionario, quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerle a su hijo comodidades, posibilidad de estudio y un ambiente de optimismo, por ello el apoyo solicitado será para la compra de materiales para montar un galpón nuevo, pollos, alimento, vacunas y vitaminas.
Jader está convencido de que este préstamo ayudara a mejorar sus ventas, sus ganancias y traerá grandes beneficios a su familia.
texts.en:
Jader is a young 23 year old man who is a responsible and cheerful husband and father. Today he wants to ask for financial help to expand his poultry raising and selling business. Despite being from the country, this young man is visionary. He wants to have a better quality of life and offer conveniences, an education and an optimistic outlook to his son. For that, the financial help he has asked for will be to buy materials to put up a new shed, and chickens, feed, vaccines and vitamins.

Jader is convinced that that this loan will help him improve his sales and his earnings and will bring great benefit to his family.

loans.use: to put up a new shed, buy feed, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing Pacifica, who is honest, hardworking and a loving mother of six. She hails from Ekerenyo, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. The Nyamira area is famous for producing world class elite runners. For the past four years she has actively been involved in mixed farming, a skill she inherited from her parents. Her primary sources of income are maize farming, egg selling and dairy. Of all the activities she is involved in, she passionately loves poultry farming.

Poultry farming is a profitable business venture in Kenya and is one of those businesses that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Although she enjoys poultry farming, the meager income she earns from poultry farming is not sufficient to satisfy her family. She wants to increase her poultry so that she can reap maximum profits. She is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. She intends to buy a high-quality breed of poultry that will be laying between 1-2 crates of eggs daily. A crate of eggs fetches $5 and with five crates she will be making $10 US a day which will boost her income greatly. Increased income will allow Pacifica to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from selling poultry meat and poultry feathers. Be inspired loan to her today!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive junto a su esposa, tienen cuatro hijos, ya son independientes, vive con su esposa y una de sus hijas que está soltera y les hace compañía, su actividad económica es atender una carpintería, el oficio lo aprendió hace 45 años y tiene su propio negocio desde hace 38 años.
Utilizará el capital para pagar la reparación del motor de su vehículo, ya que así podrá trasladar la madera que necesita para trabajar, espera resolver su dificultad en el menor tiempo para poder cumplir con los trabajos que tiene pendiente y de esta manera generar ingresos con los que pagara su deuda.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para cubrir sus gastos y no depender de sus parientes.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife. He has four children who are now independent. He lives with his wife and one of his daughters who is single and provides them company. His economic activity is running a carpentry shop. He learned the trade 45 years ago and has had his own business for 38 years.

He will use the capital to repair the motor of his vehicle then he can transport the wood he needs to work. He hopes to resolve the problem quickly so he can fulfill the outstanding work he has and in this way generate income to pay his debt. His dream is to continue to work to cover his expenses and not depend on his family.

loans.use: to repair the motor of his vehicle so he can transport the wood he needs to work.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Emmy, a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past ten years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her parents. Emmy lives near Chebilbai in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming.

Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Chebilbai area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Emmy intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully breakdowns will be few and far between. To accomplish this, Emmy is applying for a 65,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Emmy sees herself established and running more than one posho mill.

Emmy is a hardworking mum who never stops dreaming. Right now she wants to improve the conditions of her house so that her family can have a better quality of life. You can help Emmy with her dreams with just a loan.

She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Lelaitich village, situated in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Land in Lelaitich is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Lelaitich practice agriculture. Beatrice and her husband own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their lovely children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk.

Beatrice is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale. As her children grow older, their upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Beatrice needs to boost her cereal selling business. With your loan, she will be able to sell her cereals to both her neighbours and the local market. She will use the additional income from cereal sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees. All she waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 57-year-old farmer from a remote village in Ekero in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Jane will succeed in making her dreams come true. Take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 37 years old and has four children. She resides in Kericho, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for five years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Everline enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Everline has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Everline will be able to improve her income level and take care of her family. She projects that by the end of the first year she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband. Support a smallholder farmer who's hungry to improve and get ahead with her determination.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
In Nyamira area of Kenya it is normal to have a chicken farm, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely. Irene is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Nyamira. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years. To earn a decent living she sells different varieties of farm produce such as tea, and engages in numerous small personal businesses or “side hustles” as she likes to call them. Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money from poultry farming.

To Irene, raising hens is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs, but figures the quantity she produces won't make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. Irene is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life. Irene is aware of how important education is to her children. Her dream is to give them the best education she can, and that’s why she works so hard. Don’t let this dream fail; help Irene with the loan she needs and let her improve her business and her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old, strong, full of energy, and hardworking. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. Nancy has a handsome husband and two children that she really admires and would do anything so that they never lack anything. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, she has always been able to provide food for her family and also meet their basic needs. She has acquired much experience over the last 10 years, and this has helped her earn profits.

She is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 to buy poultry. Through the loan, she is sure that she will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Nyamira, which is densely populated and has ready markets for eggs and poultry. Because of the immense knowledge that Nancy has and also because of the good will she enjoys with the villagers, she will not have any challenge in selling her products. She also believes that through word of mouth, she will be able to get more customers and increase her customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Nancy and her family, and this will also allow her to make permanent changes to her life and increase her business.

Be inspired, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah, 28, is a charismatic, hardworking woman who always has enjoyed working independently, managing her time and being on her mixed farm. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained much experience.
