To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Nyamira area is very populated and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Rodah's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to expand her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. For a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profits and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

This loan will help Rodah in her poultry business and in her personal life, for her family this is a great opportunity, do it now.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet, who is 60 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Harriet is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm, she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Harriet makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Harriet can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Harriet’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Harriet a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a small-holder farmer from the Litein area of Kenya. She is a mother of one. Like many farmers in the region, she has a dairy cow. Litein has a thriving market for dairy products. Purity has sustained herself through dairy farming for seven years. She enjoys the farming lifestyle and has a connection with farm animals that goes so deep that she even names each of them. Purity has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm but, due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now.

Purity is borrowing KES 30,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production in the farm. As a result, Purity will have more quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Purity plans to settle the high farming cost of production. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.
Be inspired lend to her today!

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk sales and production.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is honest and an eloquent speaker with a strong commanding manner. She resides in Karurune, a remote village in the lush hills of Nkubu, in the central region of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family, she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is the lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that.

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. Hellen is an inspiration to many farmers in her village. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Hellen’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is an interactive and lively woman. She is very hardworking and creative and knows how to make the most of her farming business. Beatrice resides with her husband and they have been blessed with six lovely children. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 10 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at the local market. Beatrice passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Beatrice is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used for feeding the poultry, her surplus sorghum will be used to give the poultry energy and the green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, Beatrice will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Beatrice will also benefit from the resulting chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that would have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to her family because Beatrice will be able to support them and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Aricha

texts.en:
Hello, world! This is Aricha, a woman with grand aspirations. She is both humble and grateful and lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations.

Aricha is the mother of 3 lovely children, and she has been in the agriculture business for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables.

Aricha has been relying on agriculture to provide all of her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly.

Despite these tough conditions, Aricha remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high.

With this loan, Aricha will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and earn more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields.

This loan will support Aricha’s economic activity, and will improve her family’s living standards as well.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Faith, 22 years of age, is a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Litein, a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. Faith is happily married and she and her husband have four lovely children. Faith's primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Faith is a woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk sales.

The Litein area has conditions that favor dairy farming and Faith has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. She intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a breed that produces between 10-20 liters of milk a day, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Litein area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Faith is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow Faith to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

Like the responsible mother that she is, Faith dreams of giving her children a good education that will let them be good professionals in the future. Help Faith now; she just needs a little trust in her work and in her. Loan and let her have a good future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aloisia

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Aloisia, 52, a young, energetic, hardworking and focused farmer. She hails from the Chuka area, one of the most remote, rural regions in Kenya. The condition of her village speaks for itself as basic requirements such as clean water and electricity are missing. However, despite these challenges, Aloisia loves farming. She practices mixed farming, which has enabled her to take care of her aging parents. Not everything has been good for this humble and hardworking mum.

The Chuka area has a ready market for poultry products and eggs and Aloisia, being an enterprising person, wants to take advantage of this and earn profits. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming. Aloisia has got enough space on her farm and wants to make use of it through poultry farming. Other than income from selling eggs and poultry products, poultry will also provide manure to use in her farm, thus saving Aloisia money that would have been used to buy it. Aloisia projects that, after a few months, she will have more income to buy more poultry and also to repay the loan.

Aloisia is a family mum, so her dreams revolve around her family, and she wants to pay for her children's education so that they grow up to be good people. You can help Aloisia to achieve her goals; a loan will get her a lot closer.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand her farming activities

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer, who is 27 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work.

Jeniffer is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Jeniffer makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Jeniffer can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Jeniffer’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Jeniffer a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Mario Roberto

texts.es:
Mario, vive con su cónyuge, tiene parientes en el extranjero que le ayudan en ocasiones económicamente, por su parte él tiene una venta de lubricantes, mantiene un horario de nueve de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, a los alrededores de su negocio hay muchos talleres lo que le da una ventaja para mantener sus ventas estables.
Comprará repuestos y aceite para motocicletas, surtirá el negocio con nuevos productos para atender las demandas de sus clientes, podrá seguir trabajando para subsistir y cubrir sus obligaciones.
Los proyectos de vida de Mario son abrir un taller mecánico y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario lives with his spouse, he has relatives abroad who help him economically sometimes, and for his part, he sells lubricants. He has a schedule of nine in the morning to five in the afternoon; around his business there are many workshops which gives him the advantage to maintain steady sales.

He will purchase spare parts and oil for motorcycles. He will stock his business with new products to meet his customers' demand; he will be able to continue working to survive and meet his obligations.

Mario's life projects are to open a mechanic's shop and remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and oil for motorcycles, he will stock the business with new products to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, 44 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Sanganyi, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and is blessed with three children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Nyamira area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging. She feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Dorca

texts.en:
Dorca, 39, is a smallholder farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is married and has five children. Dorca practices dairy, poultry, maize and tree farming. She also runs a side business.

Dorca is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming. She intends to buy a brood of hens that will lay eggs, produce chicks and provide meat for sale. Dorca will use the income that she hopes to earn from this investment to look after her family’s well-being and her children’s education. She also wants to continue investing in poultry to make her farm bigger and more profitable.

With your support, this mum will be able to make her dreams come true. Come on, lend today.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Many people in Kenya are poor and most of them find an opportunity to make a living and progress through practicing mixed farming. Such is the case of Beatrice who, at the age of 25, has gone through many adversities but has always put on a brave face.

Beatrice resides in a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Nyamira area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Beatrice has always shown the resilience to beat all odds.

Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Beatrice started practicing mixed farming ten years ago. Her sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. The Nyamira area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market, which is the reason Beatrice is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. The motorbike will enable her to deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Beatrice is very determined to succeed. Because she is much disciplined with finances, she plans to be able to provide a secure future for herself and for her children through accumulated profits. Beatrice's dream is to provide a secure future for her children by paying their tuition fees. You will help her to realize her dream through your loan.

For Beatrice, nothing is impossible. She wants to continue working to fulfill her dream of becoming the lead supplier of farm produce in her village.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of products to the market.

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ella es Ana, es una mujer de 31 años de edad, dedica al campo y a su familia, su actividad principal es ser ama de casa, pero ya que su hogar es humilde y numero puesto que habitan su pareja y sus 4 hijos de 14, 13, 11, 6 años de edad, optó por trabajar para ayudar a generar recursos.
Su principal motivo para trabajar es que quiere pagar una educación universitaria a sus hijos, tener unas condiciones dignas de vivienda y un cambiar su realidad, por ello hoy quiere solicitar un préstamo para crecer como empresaria, dicho préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de 30 pollos y alimento de engorde al por mayor. 
El préstamo ayudara a crecer en número de aves, una movida inteligente para la temporada que se avecina en la cual se vende muy el pollo.
texts.en:
This is Ana, a 31-year-old woman, dedicated to the countryside and her family. Her primary work is being a homemaker, but as her household is humble and numerous, since she lives with her partner and their 4 children, ages 14, 13, 11 and 6, she decided to work to help to generate resources.

Her primary motivation to work is that she wants to pay for a university education for her children, to have dignified living conditions, and a change in their reality. For this, today she wants to ask for a loan to grow as a businesswoman, this loan will be invested in the purchase of 30 chicks and fattening feed in bulk.

The loan will help her to grow in the number of birds, a smart move for the upcoming season in which many chickens are sold.

loans.use: to purchase 30 chicks and fattening feed in bulk.

loans.name: Fabio De Jesus

texts.es:
Fabio es un hombre de 53 años de edad que toda su vida se ha caracterizado por ser una persona independiente que le gusta manejar su propio tiempo, actualmente se dedica a atender una chaza, donde comercializa alimentos, refrescos, snack, licores, dicho negocio lo inicio en el año 2001 y a pesar de que ha tenido múltiples dificultades que giran en torno a lo económico y la inseguridad en el sitio de trabajo, sigue en pie de lucha, trabajando honestamente para llevar el sustento para su hogar, formado por su pareja y dos hijos.
Este hombre cuyo propósito es mantener su trabajo ya que le gusta mucho lo que hace, quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de productos tales como snacks, licores y refrescos.
EL préstamo impulsara mucho su negocio, pues tendrá un aspecto muy atractivo para el público para el beneficio, podrá darles variedad de productos a sus clientes y tendrá suficientes unidades para trabajar por un buen periodo de tiempo, surtiendo gradualmente.
texts.en:
Fabio is a 53-year-old man who has been characterized his whole life as an independent person who likes to manage his own time. Currently he works tending a food stall where he sells food, soft drinks, snacks, and liquors. He began this business in the year 2001 and despite having had multiple difficulties that relate to economics and the insecurity of his work place, he continues to fight on, working honestly to bring sustenance to his household, formed of his partner and two children.

This man, whose goal is to keep his job since he likes what he does a lot, wants to ask for a loan to stock up on products such as snacks, liquors, and soft drinks.

The loan will boost his business a lot, because it will be very attractive for the public for his benefit. He will be able to provide his customers with a variety of products and will have enough back stock to work for a good while, stocking gradually.

loans.use: to stock up on products like snacks, liquors and soft drinks.

loans.name: Graciela Marilu

texts.es:
Graciela, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora estudio hasta sexto grado, porque sus padres no pudieron apoyarla más y como no pudo continuar, dedicó trabajar como empleada doméstica para poder llevar ingresos para su familia; está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a laborar como panadero, junto a él tiene 2 hijos.

Graciela, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, ella realiza el trabajo de su casa y después sale a donde los vecinos a trabajar lavando ropa y planchando, también está al pendiente de cuidar una vaca que tienen junto a su pareja.

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas, las cuales tendrán en un terreno que tienen sus suegros para alimentarlas y de esta manera venderlas en un buen precio.

Graciela, sueña con poder construir su casa de ladrillo, porque en la que vive actualmente es de bahareque y no cuenda con la sanidad para ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Graciela, 24 years old, is a determined and enterprising woman who went to school up to the sixth grade because her parents couldn't support her anymore and, since she couldn't continue, she worked as a domestic worker to bring income to her family. She is partnered, her partner works as a baker, and together they have 2 children.

Graciela has taken care of the household tasks since she was a girl, she does the housework and then goes out to the neighbors' house to work washing and ironing clothing, she also cares for a cow that she has with her partner.

She needs the loan to purchase two cows, which she will have a plot of land that her partner's parents have to feed them, and in this way to sell them at a good price.

Graciela dreams of being able to build a brick house because the one where she currently lives is made of wattle and daub and is not hygienic to offer her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Siongiroi, Kenya has a beautiful landscape made up of endless rolling hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. In her small but clean mud house, Daisy has been able to raise six angelic children who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.

Thanks to practicing mixed farming, Daisy can see a bright future. Each morning at 5:00 a.m. she rises to go to her farm in the remote village of Simotwet. She passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknames for her cows. Because of her great knowledge of farming, farmers from her village view her as a mentor.

However, the biggest challenge Daisy faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village. She is seeking a 60,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy another dairy cow of good quality. She believes that another cow will enable her to sell more milk, improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Daisy is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business, and she will be able to pay back the loan. She is confident that if she invests in her dream, she will have a positive impact on the life of her family.

Daisy is very motivated by this plan because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family. Triumph in her efforts to elevate the family’s life will do her proud.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow of good quality.

loans.name: Peria

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Peria started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud.

Although she earns profit through milk sales, Peria lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Peria believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Peria has a strong conviction and she knows that, with the support of Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, her dreams will come true. Peria waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia is a small-holder farmer from Siongiroi area of Kenya. She is a lovely mother. Like many farmers in the region, she has a dairy cow. Siongiroi has a thriving market for dairy products. Pascalia has sustained herself through dairy farming for seven years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes so deep that she even names each of them. She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now.

From Kiva lenders, Pascalia is borrowing KES 20,000 to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production in the farm. As a result, she will have more quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Pascalia can meet the high farming cost of production. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.
With your contribution, this woman will be able to achieve her dreams. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk sales and production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing Mary, an honest, hardworking and loving mother of two. She hails from Mosobeti, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. The Nyamira area is famous for banana farming and producing world class elite runners.

For the past four years, Mary has actively been involved in mixed farming, a skill she inherited from her parents. Her primary sources of income are maize farming, egg sales and dairy. Of all the activities in which she is involved, Mary passionately loves poultry farming. It is a profitable business venture in Kenya and can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Although Mary enjoys poultry farming, the meager income she earns from it is not sufficient to satisfy her family. She wants to increase her poultry business so that she can reap maximum profits.

Mary is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. She intends to buy a high quality breed of poultry that will be laying between one and two crates of eggs daily. A crate of eggs fetches $5 and, with two crates, she will be making $10 US a day, which will boost her income greatly. Increased income will allow Mary to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions. Other than increased profits, Mary will also benefit from selling poultry meat and poultry feathers.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Aurelio De Jesus

texts.es:
Aurelio es un hombre de 28 años de edad, agricultor residente del municipio del peñol, vive en unión libre con su pareja, desde pequeño despertó el sentimiento por el campo, gracias a que su padre lo llevaba a realizar los recorridos y trabajos, heredándole el campo con el que hoy genera el sustento para su hogar y familia.
Aurelio trabaja diariamente, aproximadamente 7 horas por cada día, su mayor deseo es comprar una vivienda propia y está convencido que con su trabajo puede lograrlo, pero necesita seguir creciendo para generar mayores ingresos.
Aurelio actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento y protección del cultivo.
Dichos insumos le permitirán tener una abundante cosecha la cual la vende en las plazas de mercado o a personas naturales que se acercan a su terreno.
texts.en:
Aurelio is a 28-year-old man, a farmer who lives in the municipality of Peñol, he lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. When he was little, a feeling for the countryside awoke in him, thanks to his father who brought him to do the rounds and work, bequeathing to him the field which today generates the sustenance for his home and family.

Aurelio works daily, approximately 7 hours each day. His greatest wish is to purchase his own house and he is convinced that with his work he can achieve it, but he needs to continue growing to generate more income.

Aurelio currently is asking for a loan to purchase supplies to maintain and protect his crops.

These supplies will allow him to have an abundant harvest which he will sell in the market squares or to local people who come to his land.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain and protect his crops.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Энергичный и активный мужчина Рустам. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Рустам вместе семьей живет в городе Сарбанд. Дети учатся в университете и школе. Жена работает медсестрой в больнице. Рустам очень давно начал свой деятельность. До сегодняшнего дня он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Он делает евроремонт. Рустам работает один, иногда ему помогает старший сын. Он научился от брата. Его брат тоже занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Благодаря брату Рустам сейчас кормить одевает семью. Рустам просит кредит на обучения старшего сына. Его сын учится в очном и договорном отделении. Рустам верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Rustam is an energetic and active man.  He is 40 years old, married, and the father of three children.  Rustam and his family live together in the city of Sarband.  His children are in college and school.  His wife works as a nurse at the hospital.  Long ago Rustam discovered his calling in life - to this day he has been working as a contractor who remodels homes.  He specifically does European remodels.  Rustam works alone, though sometimes his eldest son helps him.  Rustam learned from his brother, who also works as a contractor.  Thanks to his brother, Rustam can now feed and clothe his family.  Rustam is asking for a loan for his eldest son's education.  His son is studying contracts.  Rustam has faith in you and in your support.

loans.use: to pay for his eldest son's education

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a marvelous, good-hearted young woman who makes her living by practicing mixed farming. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future. Despite the many challenges that she has had, Jane has always been victorious.

Twenty-five years ago, Jane started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of five children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud.

Although Jane earns profit through milk sales, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Jane believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Despite the misfortunes she has suffered, Jane still wants to succeed and make her project a reality. Be inspired and support her!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty, the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her four children are some of the reasons that made Ruth start practicing mixed farming. Ruth is a youthful, 40-year-old farmer from Kabati, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya where people live in shanties made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. According to residents, the people of Kabati are forgotten or ignored by the county government of Thika. But within the remote village of Kabati, Ruth is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Ruth as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her four children as a primary caregiver. Ruth started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his half an acre, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize and beans. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population. Ruth is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Ruth will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her four children who are in public schools. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings.

Make a $25 loan, and push Ruth's dream closer to reality. Ruth can buy more land and succeed with your help!

loans.use: To purchase land

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a wife, mother, and farmer with 6 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Siongiroi, Kenya with her seven children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Hellen completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors.

Hellen passionately loves poultry farming and likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. Although this humble and ever smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Hellen has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity.
She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Hellen’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children.
Like Hellen, many poor smallholder farmers await for your help. Get inspired, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Rudiah

texts.en:
Rudiah is a rural woman who has had to endure many hardships in life, but she has always found the strength to press forward and continue making progress with her family. For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage and tomatoes, and keeping dairy cows.

Rudiah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profit selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of the timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. Rudiah mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her.

Rudiah is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Rudiah is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, causing her to suffer many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market in order to fetch a high price. Through this loan, Rudiah is going to achieve her dream and goals.

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Rudiah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Rudiah will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. Also she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, hence increased income level.

Rudiah is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. With your loan, Rudiah will improve her living conditions and assure her children a secure future. You can help Rudiah accomplish all her dreams through a loan that will let her be closer to them.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport produce to market.

loans.name: Patma

texts.ru: Патма, 53 года, замужем, есть дочь. У Патмы- среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Патмы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, а также 1,0 ГА собственного земельного надела, где Патма в основном выращивает пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 28,900 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Патма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Patma is 53 years old, married, and has a daughter.  Patma has a secondary education.  She works in agriculture and animal husbandry to provide income for her family.  Thanks to Patma's hard work, she now has 3 cows and her own 1.0 hectare plot of land, on which she raises wheat for resale.  Her monthly income is about 28,900 KGS.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Patma turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cows.  With the income from the loan she plans to save towards the purchase of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy some cows to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Peterline

texts.en:
A dream of getting out of poverty, the will to get ahead and to secure the future of her children are some of the reasons that made Peterline start practicing mixed farming. Peterline is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. She is based in Kapolecho, a remote village in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming. The region's staple food is mursik, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk.

Peterline has been selling eggs and milk and this has earned her a decent income. She also engages in another business to make ends meet. Peterline passionately loves dairy farming and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She wakes up every morning to milk her cows. While this humble mom has been making a profit by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk.

Peterline is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions. You can help Peterline to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en: Milkah is wife and mother dedicated to her work. At age 33, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, in her mixed farm, tirelessly working. Milkah is one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Kabati, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. She is happily married to Nelson, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two lovely children. For the past 8 years she has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops she to earn a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although Milkah makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Milkah comes from an area where there is no water connection, so she is always forced to walk a long distance for this “precious commodity." Milkah faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health. Milkah is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Milkah wants to change that notion by saving rain water to start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan, Milkah will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. Milkah is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via KIVA lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Milkah’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Con la clara intención de ser competente, mejorar sus ingresos,  consolidar su negocio, la señora Gloria quien tiene 54 años de edad, la cual es casada y se dedica a la venta de mercancía como artículos religioso y prendas femeninas, quiere solicitar su primer préstamo con una entidad financiera, el cual usara en la compra de surtido variado de artículos relacionados con la religión católica.
Para ella, fue una enorme alegría encontrar una entidad que la apoyara y confiara en su empresa, su principal sueño es comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and married. She sells goods such as religious items and women's clothing. She has a clear intention to be competent, to increase income, and to build her business.

She requests her first loan with a financial institution to buy assortment of items related to Catholicism.

It was a great joy for Gloria to find an institution that supports and trusts her company. Her highest dream is to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy assortment of items related to Catholicism.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Rosaline resides in the Siongiroi area of Kenya, which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family.

Rosaline’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business (motorbike business) she engages in to make ends meet. Rosaline has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Siongiroi area has conditions that favor dairy farming.

Rosaline has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow - it’s a breed that produces between 10-15 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Siongiroi area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Rosaline is going to have more milk and comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Rosaline to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29-year-old mother. She is a happy mother because just one year ago the greatest joy arrived at her home -- her infant child, whom she loves and gives everything for.

Rose farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Siongiroi, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and beans. She also keeps dairy cows and does a side-hustle business. Rose has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Rose is looking to start sheep farming in a bid to diversify. As with many agricultural enterprises, the profit margins in sheep farming are high. Therefore, raising sheep will be a day-to-day job to Rose.

To kick-start the business, Rose is seeking a loan to buy sheep. As a sheep farmer, she will derive her income from the sale of lambs and wool. From the additional income, she plans to service her loan and meet her family's basic needs.

With your support, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Please make the decision to give her a loan!

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Caroline, 27, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is a mother of three adorable lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet.

She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity.

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 10-15 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Caroline is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 56 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, по специальности она связист, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и садоводством на 0,80 Га земли, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 20 овец и лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для завершения постройки сарая для скота. Доходы от бизнеса Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и обучение младшего сына.
texts.en: Venera is 56 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children.  She has a secondary education with specialization as a telephone worker.  She began working in animal husbandry and farming 17 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 15,000 KGS to provide income for her family.  Thanks to Verena's hard work, she now has 2 cows, 20 sheep, and a horse.  Her monthly income is about 22,000 KGS.  With the goal of further expanding her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase building materials to construct a barn for her animals.  Venera plans to use the income from her business to save toward the further expansion of her business and toward her younger son's education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Catherine, who is a 35-year-old smallholder farmer from Nkubu area in the central region of Kenya. Catherine owns a 2-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This kind mother keeps dairy animals and grows a variety of crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming.

Catherine is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Catherine. Through a group of 15 members called Njoe, Catherine has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral.

According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Catherine because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Viviana Patricia

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer de 32 años de edad, la cual inició un negocio como independiente en el año 2014 de venta de mercancía por catálogo, la cual funciona de la siguiente manera; ella muestra las revistas, los clientes realizan el pedido, ella compra y da un tiempo de 1 mes para que le paguen los pedidos.
Está actividad la inicio por necesidad económica ya que su esposo se veía ajustado para cubrir los gastos de su hogar el cual es formado por ellos dos y sus 3 hijas de 9, 3 y 2 años de edad.
Pensando en generar ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, Viviana quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercancía con la que cubrirá unos pedidos que tiene pendientes, el apoyo monetario servirá para mejorar sus ventas, aumentar su inventario y su cupo con las revistas y consolidarse en el sector.
texts.en:
Viviana is 32 years old. She started a business on her own in 2014 of catalog merchandise sales. She shows the catalog to the customers. Once they make the order, she buys the merchandise and gives her customers 1 month to pay for the orders.

She started the business for economic necessity. Her husband was strained to cover the household expenses for them and their three daughters at 9, 3 and 2 years of ages.

Viviana requests a loan to buy merchandise that will cover some pending orders. This will help improve sales, increase the inventory and the quotas, and establish herself in the sector. She is hoping to generate income to improve the quality of life and to ensure the education of their children.

loans.use: to cover the orders of household products.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 58 year-old dealer/wholesaler of eggs and beverages from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Salvador and they have grown up children. Salvador is not just her companion in life but also her business buddy. Together, they toil hard in order to uplift their business.

As a wholesaler of eggs, softdrinks and beverages, Rosario buys trays of eggs and loads of bottled drinks at wholesale price then retails it per tray, case or per bottle. She distributes these products to sari-sari stores. She has been doing this for almost three years and it provided well for their everyday needs. However the problem in this kind of business is the risk of egg and bottle breakage that consumes big portion of capital. The unreturned bottles which are considered lost also depletes her capital. Good thing about Rosario is that she knows how to roll her everyday budget. She dreams of putting up her own outlet or stock room someday. She feels that this dream is coming closer to reality, especially if she can avail of a PHP 20,000 loan. Part of the loan will be used to buy additional trays of egg and cases of beverage and the rest will be allotted for financial assistance to her daughter who will be delivering a child soon. As a loving mother, Rosario wants to be sure that her daughter will be taken care of in a reputable hospital.

Rosario is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of egg and cases of beverage; financial assistance to her daughter's delivery

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: 31 летный образованный парень Фаридун. Он отец двоих 2 и 8 летный детей. Фаридун проживает в городе под название Душанбе. Душанбе столица Республики Таджикистан. Жители города Душанбе образованные, миролюбивые, талантливые, активные, дружные, умные и честные. Фаридун один из тех жителей. Он работает и учится в университете. Фаридун работает юристом в Точиксодиротбанке. Он учится, чтобы получить вторую образованию. Фаридун хочет оплатить на обучения, чтобы продвигать и успешно закончить обучения. По этой причине Фаридун обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Faridun is an educated, 31 year old young man.  He is the father of two - a 2 year old and an 8 year old.  Faridun lives in a city called Dushanbe.  Dushanbe is the capital of the Republic of Tajikistan.  Residents of Dushanbe are educated, peace-loving, talented, active, friendly, intelligent, and honest.  Faridun is such a person.  He works and studies at the university and works as a lawyer for Tojik Sodirot Bank.  He is studying in order to receive a second degree.  Faridun wants to pay for his studies in order to advance and successfully complete his education.  For this reason he has requested a loan.  He is depending on your support.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Alicia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy thread, garments, and other materials needed in her business for her tailoring business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, garments, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Geelyn

texts.en:
Geelyn is 34 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Geelyn has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Geelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear like pants, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

Geelyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Geelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear like pants, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 51 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elma has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, can goods, junk foods, soap, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Elma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Nilda has been in this business for 7 years. Nilda earns more income from general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and has three children. She resides in Siongiroi, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for five years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming.

Leah enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Leah has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Leah will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions.

Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es:
Sandra es una madre cabeza de familia de 38 años de edad. Tiene dos pequeños, la mayor de 10 y el menor 6 años de edad, ella actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo la razón es que busca iniciar un negocio de venta de productos fritos, puesto que quedó sin empleo y necesitar alimentar su familia, espera obtener apoyo y sacar a su familia adelante, trabajando con honestidad y perseverara para alcanzar sus sueños de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y pagar la educación de sus muchachos.
Con el dinero comprara una freidora e insumos para realizar, pasteles, palos de queso, buñuelos, empanadas entre otros.
texts.en:
Sandra is a mother and the head of household. She is 38 years old. She has two small children at 10 and 6 years of age. She requests a loan to start a business selling fried products. Since she lost her job but still needing to feed her family, she is hoping to obtain support and get her family ahead. She is working with honesty and perseverance to achieve her dreams to improve the quality of life for her family and to pay for the education for her children.

Sandra requests a loan to buy a deep fryer and ingredients to make cakes, cheese sticks, donuts, pies etc.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer and ingredients to make cakes, cheese sticks, donuts, pies etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 59-year-old farmer. She is the mother of a lovely family and is hardworking, humble, and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kenyenya, Kenya, which is a town near the famous Lake Victoria (Africa's biggest lake). Margaret and her husband are blessed with a lovely family.

Margaret has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs and cows for milk and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Margaret is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Margaret is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm inputs. This move is quite a big deal for her. With the loan she will be able to buy farm inputs such as animal feeds and fertilizers that will help in increasing production in her farm.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mamta Mukesh And Group

texts.en:
Mamta is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her family in the Jhabua district of Madhya Pradesh. She leads a group of 5 women in her locality. She wants to start a business of selling products made out of bamboo. She expects her household income to rise by a substantial amount of Rs. 2000 per month. She plans to sell products like baskets, floor mats, floor, cleaners, etc. But she does not have the funds to afford the purchase of the raw materials to make these products. 

Just like Mamta, the other members of the group also want to start a business of selling products made of bamboo. They too lack the funds to purchase raw materials to start their businesses. Thus, these women have come together, under the leadership of Mamta, to apply for a group loan to kick start their respective businesses.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to start her business of selling products made out of bamboo.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph's desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite his age (42) and the obstacles he has experienced, he doesn't reduce his efforts to achieve his objective - what he sets out for, he gets. He is so humble and honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth.

Joseph is a father of lovely children that he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Joseph started farming and has been doing farming for the past ten years. Through those years, he has gathered so much experience that all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Joseph practices mixed farming on his farm and, through the profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs and also give his children a good education because he believes that education is the key to success.

Joseph is a farmer who is very enterprising and he is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products, Joseph wants to take advantage of those and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Joseph to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Joseph hopes that, through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. Joseph’s dreams and projections are that, by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables.

Through this he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Joseph is not a selfish man and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

Help this smallholder farmer with dreams and goals to realize! Come on--make a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Lunny

texts.en:
Lunny is 29 years old and is blessed with a lovely family. She resides in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. She has been practicing farming for ten years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming.

Lunny enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Lunny has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Lunny will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her family.

With your support, this hardworking woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Please make the decision to give her a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Working in the fields is one of the hardest jobs nowadays, due to the great effort that must be made to get ahead in it, but Joyce is a smallholder farmer who has never given up, regardless of bad weather or unfortunate circumstances. She is always willing to get the resources her family needs.

Joyce, 41, loves dairy farming! A very large portion of her farm is allocated for dairy only. Besides her attachment to cows, what makes dairy farming attractive to Joyce is the thriving milk market in Kenyenya where she hails from. To grow the dairy business, Joyce is seeking support from individual international Kiva lenders.

With the contribution from Kiva lenders, Joyce is going to construct proper housing for her dairy animals. The housing will provide shelter, protection, and a hygienic environment conducive to her animals' well-being. The housing also paves way for the introduction of a zero-grazing model which has proved successful and profitable in multiple dairy farms.

Joyce's desire to get ahead is admirable. She wants to ensure a bright and tranquil future. You can help her accomplish her dreams by taking heart and making a loan. Invest in Joyce and empower a progressive farmer, a wife, and a mother from the Kenyenya area of Kenya.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзада, 37 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Айзады - среднее образование, работает уборщицей в школе, также на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айзады, у нее в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 12 овец, 2 лошади. На 1,50 Га собственной земли, она выращивает люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Айзады составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). Семья занимается любимым делом, которое хочет развивать и дальше. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Айзада обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, Айзада будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Aizada is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Aizada has a secondary education and works as a janitor at the school.  She has also worked for many years in agriculture and animal husbandry.  Thanks to Aizada's hard work, she now has 6 cows, 12 sheep, and 2 horses.  On a 1.50 hectare plot of land, she also raises alfalfa to sell.  Her monthly income is about 13,000 KGS.  Her family is also engaged in this beloved business, which they hope to expand continue.  For this reason, and for the purpose of further developing the business, Aizada turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase sheep to fatten and resell.  With the income from her business, Aizada will save toward the further expansion of the business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Esther (pictured above) from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Esther is 55 years old and a proud mother of angel-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. Other than doing some small business, Esther is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming.

Esther practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows.

Although Esther has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, Esther will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins.

Through this loan, Esther will be able to expand her farming business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Esther will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education.

Esther has many dreams. The main one is to make her farming business successful so that one day her children can inherit it and keep it so they have something to provide for themselves. You can help Esther to accomplish this dream and all her goals with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, is a 50-year-old smallholder farmer who always brings a pleasant feeling when she is at home. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya. Being a mother comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding her large family requires a lot of hard wor. Alice started farming just after finishing high school since she never advanced her education. Because of the high unemployment rate, she ventured into farming, and she has never regretted this because of the profits she has been making. Alice practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardest working farmers in her village because she is able to juggle between keeping pigs, cows and also doing crop farming. Alice is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do pig farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges she has faced is lack of capital.

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy additional pigs. The Chuka area has the highest demand for pork meat and through this loan; Alice is going to sell her pork meat to the nearby market and also to her neighbours. Other than pork meat, she will also benefit from the manure from the pigs waste which will save her the cost that she used to incur buying fertilizers. Alice is relieved to know that her life can be secured through partners such as Kiva who help small-scale and aspiring women such as Alice.
You can help Alice with a loan and get her so much closer to her goals.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 63 years old and he is a widower with two children. For the past ten years he has operated a four-acre mixed farm in Kirege village located in the Central province of Kenya. He keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows maize, vegetables, and other crops on his farm. He is constantly upgrading and introducing new ways and approaches of doing business to make his farm more sustainable for the environment while still being profitable.

Ephantus is seeking a loan to fully incorporate zero-grazing into his farm. The cattle management system on his farm is shifting from being extensive (which is confined to ranches and large-scale farms) to being intensive. The intensive systems are the most predominant and comprise zero-grazing and semi-zero-grazing systems. With your funding, the introduction of zero-grazing will create significant value for Ephantus business. Returns from this investment will be put back into the business to drive its evolution into a modern practice. Your loan will elevate the quality of life for Ephantus and his family. You can help Ephantus to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to start a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline's primary source of income has been eggs, crops, and a personal business. She has been practicing farming for the past 11 years. Having done farming for such a long time, she has gained so much experience that she is always ranked the best farmer in her village. Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Nandi tribe (Eveline’s tribe). Demand for dairy milk has been high and Eveline wants to take advantage of the market.

Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Eveline has already identified the breed of dairy cow that she wants. Eveline always says that, “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.”

Through the loan, Eveline will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure that will be used in improving the fertility of her farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer.

Eveline has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that she underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training session, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits, Eveline plans to permanently improve her living conditions. She plans that through increased income, she will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, hence saving costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas resides in Cheptobei, a remote village in the lush hills of Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Her primary source of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that.

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Dorcas’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Doline

texts.en:
Doline is 56 years old and lives in the Chuka area of Kenya. She has four children.
Fifteen years ago Doline started farming on a small piece of inherited land in Chuka. Today, she sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.
