Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Doline believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Patima

texts.ru: Патима успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна всем инвесторам и Фонду Кива за поддержку. На данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, лошадь. На 1,20 Га земли выращивает перец и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 3,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Патима обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и мечтает накопить на отдых с супругом в санатории у озера.
texts.en: Patima successfully paid off her previous loan and used it for its intended purpose.  She is very grateful to all of the investors and to Kiva for its support.  She now owns 4 cows and a horse and raises peppers and clovers on a 1.20 hectare plot of land.  Her monthly income is about 3,600 KGS.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Patima turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase a young bull.  With the income from the loan she plans to save toward the further development of her business and dreams of saving toward a vacation with her husband to a sanitarium (health resort) near a lake.

loans.use: to purchase a young bull to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha quien sale todos los días a trabajar 12 horas con su maleta (ver foto) donde vende snack, es una generado de sueños, ella vive en unión libre con su pareja, no tiene preparación escolar, tampoco experiencia en trabajo, pero tiene lo más importante muchas ganas de trabajar y progresar, de sacar adelante sus hijos, de cumplir sus sueños de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, ver su hijos graduarse en una universidad, por ello trabaja con esa intensidad horaria y ahora quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para amplair su surtido de su chaza.
texts.en: Martha goes out every day with her case to work 12 hours (see the photo) where she sells snack food. She is a creator of dreams. She lives common-law with her partner. She has no schooling nor any work experience. But she has the most important thing, great desire to work and progress and get her children ahead. She also wants to fulfill her dreams of improving her housing conditions and see her children graduate from university. So she is working extensive hours and now she wants to request economic support to expand the stock of her stand.

loans.use: to buy a stock of snack food.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 42 years old, married with 5 school age kids living in Pagadian City. She runs and operates a motor repair shop and motor spare parts store with her husband as repair mechanics. She is doing well in her husband and is supported by Paglaum MPC as her financial partner. Currently, she asks a loan from the cooperative to buy additional stocks of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spare parts

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a married woman with 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice,soda, flour, milk, bread and other household items.. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation of goods to the shop.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, milk and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier of goods within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour, milk and other items

loans.name: Mariselah

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Mariselah lives with her handsome husband in Nkubu, a small rural town in Kenya. The Nkubu area is also referred to as the banana region of Kenya because most of the bananas consumed are from that region.

She has been farming for the past five years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, she sells milk, banana, eggs, and a variety of food crops. Mariselah is satisfied with the returns she gets through farming.

However, she wants to diversify and start horticultural farming. The main challenge she faces is accessing funds. She is kindly requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. To access funds, Mariselah joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions.

When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo, she answered, “They assist small-scale farmers.” Through horticulture, she will be able to improve her living standards and secure the future of her family. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Mariselah is to permanently improve her family’s livelihood.

Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Teresa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, dish washing liquid, candies, coffee, can goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Janet started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Mikinduri, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding.

A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Janet believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

With your contribution, this honest and humble mum will be able to achieve her dreams. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Eustace

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Eustace, a very hardworking, energetic father of three lovely children. Eustace resides in the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities.

He has been doing mixed farming for the past five years and through those years he has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming, he has been able to take care of his family and also provide the basic needs for his children.

Eustace is a very enterprising man, and although he never got formal education, he has always worked hard on his farm and he has always assured his family of a decent meal. The Nkubu area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, he is sure that he will reap maximum profits and be able to increase his business. Being a small holder farmer and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Eustace feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising men like him.

Despite the obstacles that have occurred, this smallholder farmer is not giving up. He strives day to day to get his family ahead and fulfill. You can be part of this dream. Come on--make a loan!

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. She has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children.

Pamela is one of the hardest-working women on planet earth; she is a 30-year-old go-getter from Chania, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Pamela has defied all the odds and has farmed for five years. Her primary sources of income are growing crops and raising animals. She earns additional income through a side hustle business.

Pamela is contented with the farming way of life and is a very enterprising woman. She hasn't had formal employment but always worked hard on her farm to provide her children and family with decent meals. The Nkubu area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming which is why she seeks a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and increase her business.

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Pamela feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women. Pamela is well disciplined with finances and she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Pamela so that her horticulture farm can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.ru: Гулзар успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у Гулзар в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, дополнительно занимается реализацией одежды на вещевом рынке. Также работает завучем в школе. Деятельность Гулзар приносит до 36,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Гулзар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и хочет дать образование ее сыну.
texts.en: Gulzar successfully paid off her previous loan, and used it for its intended purpose.  She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who helped her financially.  She now owns 2 cows, 2 horses, and also sells clothes at the clothing market.  She also works as the head teacher at the local school.  Gulzar's efforts bring in about 36,000 KGS per month.  With the goal of further expanding her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cattle to increase the size of her herd.  With the income from the loan, Gulzar plans to save towards the further development of her business and also hopes to provide her son an education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Basibika

texts.en:
Basibika is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents.

For the past 5 years, the secondary-educated entrepreneur has run a mixed farm, where she keeps productive dairy cows that produce milk for both consumption and sale. Basibika farms on a half-acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have little to do with agriculture. Basibika was farming for subsistence, but recently switched to commercial production. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status and enabled her to afford her children a better education at standard private schools. Basibika is seeking a loan to purchase animal feed. She is seeking this loan to ensure that her animals have the proper feed composition that they require. The returns from this investment will enable Basibika to pay for her children's education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children's future.
With your help, this smallholder farmer will invest in a better future for himself. Step up and make a loan

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 24 and a very industrious, honest, and hardworking mother from the Nkubu area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. She has been farming and over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, maize, crops, and some small business ventures that help him make ends meet.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy seeds. Kenya's Nkubu area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Valerie, but she now feels farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Valerie has many dreams in her life but, as expected, her family is the principal one: she wants to give them a good quality of life, to pay for her children's education and, someday, buy a house so that they can all live safely and comfortably. You can help Valerie to fulfill all of these goals with a loan that will get her a lot closer to achieving them.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals so as to expand her brokerage in this commodity.

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан, 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей и дочь. Дети взрослые, самостоятельные, проживают отдельно. У Гулжан высшее педагогическое образование, она трудолюбивая, спокойная и доброжелательная. Гулжан работает в средней школе учителем биологии. В качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад с 5,000 сомов (KGS). Гулжан на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 17 овец и 3 лошади. На 1,14 Га земли она выращивает люцерну, есть сад. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для закупки корма для скота. Гулжан намерена создать благоприятные условия для зимовки скота, сохранив поголовье. Доходы от бизнеса она планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulzhan is 51 years old, married, and together with her spouse is raising 3 sons and a daughter.  Her children are grown, independent, and live by themselves.  Guljhan has a degree in teaching.  She is hard working, peaceful, and friendly.  Gulzhan works in the secondary school as a biology teacher.  In order to provide further income for her family, she has also worked for 19 years in agriculture and animal husbandry, starting with only 5,000 KGS.  Gulzhan now has 3 cows, 17 sheep, and 3 horses, and raises alfalfa and has a garden on a 1.14 hectare plot of land.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Gulzhan turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase feed for her cattle.  Gulzhan is trying to provide for and keep her cattle safe during the winter.  With the income from her loan, she plans to save toward further increasing the size of her herd, and plans to save toward home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Lilies

texts.en:
Lilies, 67, has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Lilies is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it, and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt.

Lilies dreams of having a successful business and she’s aware that she has to work hard to accomplish that, but with a little help it could be easier for her to fulfill her goals, so loan now and help him get closer to them.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 68 years old and a strong example of hard work. She works untiringly every day of the week, from Monday to Sunday, to give her family a comfortable life.

She is based in Kianjeri village, in the Central region of Kenya. The secondary-educated entrepreneur runs a mixed-farm where she keeps poultry and a fairly-productive dairy cow that produce milk for both consumption and sale.

Hellen started farming four years ago. She farms on a three acre piece of land that belongs to her husband,. She was farming for subsistence but recently switched it up for commercial produce. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status to enable her to afford a better private school education for her children.

Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter. In her dairy business, she places more importance on animal health and nutrition than other factors. The chaff cutter is handy during feed preparation to ensure that the hay is evenly cut into appropriately small pieces that cows will enjoy and easily digest.

Returns from this investment will enable Hellen to pay for her child’s education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children’s future.
You can help Hellen to accomplish that and a lot more with just giving him the loan she needs.

loans.use: To buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Meerkan

texts.ru: Мээркан, 60 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Мээркан среднее образование. Она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного источника доходов, Мээркан занимается сельским хозяйством. Семья Мээркан очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие, все помогают по хозяйству. На сегодня у Мээркан есть 2 коровы, 30 овец, 2 лошади, На 3,33 Га земли она выращивает фасоль, растут плодоносящие деревья. Ежемесячная прибыль Мээркан 18,900 сом (KGS). Свои доходы от бизнеса Мээркан старается инвестировать в бизнес-деятельность. В этом году, посоветовавшись с семьей, она решила построить времянку. Поэтому и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Свои доходы Мээркан будет направлять в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en:
Meerkan is 60 and married with four children. She has a high school education and is retired, and farms as an additional source of income. Her family is happy and gets along very well and everyone helps with the farm. She currently has two cows, 30 sheep and two horses as well as 3.33 hectares of land where she grows beans and keeps fruit trees. Her monthly income is 18,900 KGS, and she tries to invest profits back into the business.

This year, having consulted with her family, Meerkan has decided to build a temporary house, and therefore she has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase building materials. She will put profits into further developing her business and into improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a temporary house

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren, an ever smiling, hardworking and honest mum. She hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. Caren earns income through selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for the past two years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

She faces financial challenges, and because the Kericho area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and to thus improve her income.

Caren’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements in life, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Caren is visionary, and with her accumulated profits she hopes to be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Marlenis Del Rosario

texts.es:
Marlenis es una mujer de 52 años de edad la cual se dedica a la venta de alimentos, se siente feliz y contenta porque está atravesando un gran momento en su empresa, las ventas son buenas, sus clientes están volviendo y piensa que es el mejor momento para invertir en su negocio, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo que usara en la compra de: 8 sillas, 2 mesas, reparar el carro de comidas rápidas y comprar surtido de productos para la preparaciones de chuzos, chorizos, hamburguesas, perros calientes, papas a la francesa, etc.
Su principal propósito en la vida es mantener su hogar pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlenis is a 52 year old woman who works selling foods. She feels happy and content as her business is doing very well. Her sales are good, her clients are returning so she thinks it is the best time to invest in her business. So she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy 8 chairs, 2 tables, repair her food cart and buy an assortment of products for the preparation of kebabs, chorizo (sausage), hamburgers, hot dogs, french fries, etc.

Her main goal in life is to support her household, pay her children's education and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 chairs, 2 tables, repair her food cart and buy supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old. She is an honest, sensible, charismatic, and hard-working woman. She is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.

Mary is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, growing maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Mary has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not discouraged her. She states: “I have to do something for my family."

She requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Mary is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) that require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Mary to achieve her dream and reach her goals.

The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Mary will never suffer losses due to delays in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase.

Mary is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Mary will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and blessed with three children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are selling milk and pig farming. Deciding to practice pig farming was not a difficult decision for Janet. She has earned a decent income from pig farming for six years. The demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase the number of pigs, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds, so she seeks a loan to purchase additional pigs.

Pig farming is a less strenuous activity and it is profitable. Many pig farmers find a sense of fulfillment having pigs all over their homestead. If taken seriously, pig farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for pork products is always high. With your loan, Janet is going to earn more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. Janet is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer with 6 children. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. Although she has faced many obstacles that has not been a set back because Margaret has been making great profits in farming.

Ndaragwa is one of the places that has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming, that is good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Margaret has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Through Kionoki self-help group which is a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan.. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.
You can help Margaret to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is a 44-year-old a very hardworking mother and has a lovely family, which she really adores so much, and will always do anything good to prevent them from ever going to bed with hungry stomachs.

Bilha hails from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but these realities did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Bilha has been farming for the past twenty years.

Bilha practices mixed farming (crop and animal farming). With her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs. She is very enterprising, and she is seeking a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Bilha wants to take advantage of various conditions -- favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products -- and reap more profits.

Bilha hopes that she will improve her living conditions through this loan. By the end of the first year, her dreams and projections are that she will not only be selling in the local market, but also in international markets through the export of fruits and vegetables. Through these endeavours, she will be able to assure her family a secure future.

Bilha is not a selfish mother and she wants to help society, which is why she will employ people on her horticulture farm; hence, have an impact on society. Help Bilha to accomplish this dream and more with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mawulikplimi

texts.fr: Mawulikplimi est un homme marié âgée de 59 ans résidant à Tokoin. Père d’un enfant, Mawulikplimi est une revendeuse de savons liquide, de pommades et des perles qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend par livraison à domicile. Mawulikplimi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des lots de savons liquide en vue de bien revendre afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider son enfant dans son éducation.
texts.en: Mawulikplimi is a 59 year old married man, living in Tokoin. Father of one child, Mawulikplimi is a re-seller of liquid soap, ointment and beads, who stocks up three times a month at the market and resells by home delivery. Mawulikplimi asks for this loan to order packs of liquid soap with a view to re-sell well in order to meet his client's demands and to have significant financial autonomy in order to assist in his child's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 packs of liquid soap.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel, 49, is a smallholder farmer residing in Eldoret, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. He is arguably the most successful client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Maize is Samwel’s flagship produce. He sells more than 100 bags of maize.

Back in the late 1990’s, Samwel practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was doing only half an acre of maize crop per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for survival.

Today, Samwel is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. He has already serviced other asset-based loans fully from Juhudi Kilimo! Through the loans, he has acquired high quality poultry birds, a dairy unit and horticultural input. He has employed people to help run his agribusiness.

To capitalize more on returns from the booming horticulture farming, Samwel is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to build a greenhouse. Unlike his competition, Samwel conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce.

Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Samwel’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse. In the future, he is also planning to introduce zero grazing method, intensify his maize farming, and start value addition.
Samwel shows everybody that it is never too late to fulfill dreams, and he wants to accomplish a lot more, like improving the condition of his house. You can be part of this beautiful story by supporting him with the loan he needs.

loans.use: To construct a green house

loans.name: Umutkan

texts.ru: Умуткан, 42 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается торговлей продуктами питания на рынке. В обороте есть товар на сумму 170,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль Умуткан - около 32,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от бизнеса она и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие ее дела.
texts.en: Umutkan is 42 years old, widowed, and the mother of 2 children.  She has a secondary education, and works in retail, selling food at the market.  Her turnover amounts to 170,000 KGS.  Umutkan's monthly income is about 32,000 KGS.  She turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase more food products to diversify her offerings.  With the income from her business she plans to further invest in the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase food products to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, a 43-year-old jovial father of lovely children whom he refers to as his “heartbeat.” Jacob hails from the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Siongiroi has a good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Jacob is a very hardworking man who enjoys farming, which he has been doing on his small piece of land for the past 13 years. Through all those years, he has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in his village.

Being a caring and loving father, Jacob has been able to take care of his family and support them through the profits he has earned from farming. Although Jacob reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that he is facing that is dragging him down and preventing him from reaching the top of the skies is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Jacob is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to buy a piece of land and expand his farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Jacob is sure that he will make good use of the land and double his profit levels. Jacob is sure that if you invest in him, he will be able to realize his dream of having a good quality life and securing his children's future. Jacob has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan.
Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan man! He aspires to have a very productive end quarter of the year.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah, instilled with a hard-working and adventurous spirit, has been making a living through mixed farming over the past 10 years with a set goal in mind: to be able to get ahead and, together with his family, build a good future. His primary sources of income have been milk and poultry.

The Tumaini area has only one diesel posho mill that serves many people, but the mill keeps breaking down, so farmers are not able to grind their maize. Elijah intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. Maize meal is very common in Tumaini village and is a staple food for many communities. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging.

Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. Through this loan, Elijah will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. This loan will help Elijah to change his life and achieve his life's mission of bringing economic development and poverty alleviation to communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Elijah promises to fully repay on time.
Elijah is a man with a clear goal to work hard, accomplish his dreams, and support his family. This is just the beginning and you can be part of this story by loaning and supporting the dreams of this hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy an electric posho mill.

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru: Зухра успешно погасила свой кредит, использовала средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В обороте в магазине Зухры на сегодняшний день есть достаточно товара (одежды и канцелярских принадлежностей), ежемесячная прибыль - 52,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды на продажу. Доходы от кредита Зухра планирует направить на расширение ее бизнеса, также на приобретение автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Zukhra successfully paid of her previous loan, and used it for its intended purpose.  She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who helped her financially.  The inventory of Zukhra's business now has enough product (clothing and stationary), and her monthly income is 52,000 KGS.  With the goal of expanding her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase clothing to sell.  Zukhra plans to use the income from her loan to invest in the further development of her business, and also to purchase a car for her family.

loans.use: to increase the turnover of clothes in her shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Speaking with Ruth, it becomes obvious that she is a very hard-working and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar, along with a handsome husband and their two angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her as well as poor productivity. Ruth is seeking a loan to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm.

Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Ruth and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a youthful, 30-year-old farmer from a remote village in Nandihills area of Kenya where people live in shanties made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. According to residents, the people of Nandihills are forgotten or ignored by the county government. But within the remote village in Nandihills Faith is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Faith as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her two children as a primary caregiver. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 5 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize and tea. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Faith is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Faith will have more space to expand her business output. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her two children who are in public schools. She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings.
Make a $25 loan, and push Faith's dream closer to reality. Faith can buy more land and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to buy land .

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a smiling and proud rural smallholder farmer who lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area full of hard-working and honest people. Irene, with her mixed farm, generates the income to sustain her family. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 20 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children.

She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Kitale area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Irene's upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems.. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Irene has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Irene is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline lives in Solai, a typical village in the Nyahururu area of Kenya where people suffer from poverty and lack of capital. Most people who live in this area are smallholder farmers. She has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. She believes in the slogan "Unity is strength," which is why she decided to join Jupa self-help group.

For the past three years, Magdaline has been actively involved in mixed farming, sheep rearing, and poultry farming. She never got the chance to get a white collar job, but this has not been a setback. She has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements such as fertilizers, seeds and tools.

She is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements, such as high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Magdaline is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives near Kapcherop in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Kapcherop area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Mary intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area.

She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. To accomplish this, Anna is applying for a 75,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Anna sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an electric posho (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 41-year-old lady who has a beautiful family; they are the driving force of Patricia´s life and the reason why she works so hard in her farming business. She is a smallholder farmer based in Ndaragwa, which is a small rural town in the central region of Kenya.

For ten years, Patricia has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women.

She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. Patricia just needs a little help, and you can give it to her now so that she can accomplish all that she dreams of.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Twenty years ago, Salina started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Salina believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Beatrice, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They didn't just get together romantically. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 7 children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
For many years, Alice has been engaged in mixed farming in the remote town of Kitale. In this way, she supplements her meager income which has helped her 11 children get ahead in the world. Her tenacity and perseverance have enabled her to strive tirelessly, always looking for a way to get ahead.

Her major sources of income are selling milk and eggs, growing crops, and engaging in personal business to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. Because of the high-quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming.

To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence, satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used to improve her living conditions.

She plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish and provide a solid education for her 11 children. Support a Kenyan woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry to increase her business and support her 11 children.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Айнура имеет среднее образование, работает уборщицей в местной школе. Воспитала в себе аккуратность, пунктуальность, она целеустремленна и трудолюбива. Айнура в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 4 коровы, 15 овец и лошадь. На 0,33 Га земли она выращивает люцерну. Хозяйство Айнуры приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Ainura is 33 years old, married, and is raising 3 children.  Ainura has a secondary education and works as a janitor in the local school.  She has developed in herself accuracy and punctuality, and is ambitious and hardworking.  Since the year 2000, Ainura's work in animal husbandry and agriculture has served as an additional source of income for her family.  Thanks to Ainura's hard work, she now has 4 cows, 15 sheep, and a horse, and a 0.33 hectare plot of land on which she raises alfalfa.  Ainura's business provides her approximately 9,000 KGS per month, which helps her pay for food and for her family's needs.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Ainura turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase sheep to fatten and sell.  With the income from the loan Ainura plans to invest in the further expansion of her business, and also in the future plans to save toward purchasing a car.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 44 years old and a proud mother of 2 children. Hellen is a very hardworking farmer. She has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Hellen practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income.

Although Hellen has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest lately, because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds, and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seeds, so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Using this loan, Hellen will be able to expand her horticulture business. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Hellen will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses.

She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day, to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. You can help Hellen with this dream with a loan; that would mean a lot to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and seeds, and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 29-year-old go-getter, with 3 children, from Kachibora, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Monicah has defied all the odds and has farmed for five years. Her primary sources of income are growing crops and raising animals.

Monicah is content with the farming way of life and is a very enterprising woman. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming which is why she seeks a loan to buy seeds to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and increase her business. Monicah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women. Monicah is well disciplined with finances and she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Monicah so that her horticulture farm can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.ru: Абдусамат из города Истаравшан. Ему 41 лет.  Абдусамат живет вместе с матерью, женой и двоими детьми. У него одна дочка и один сын. Дети хорошо воспитанные и взрослые. Абдусамат хочет, чтобы дети выросли воспитанным и были образованным. Его жена тоже умная, гостеприимная  женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. Абдусамат хочет заниматься производством мороженное. У Абдусамат имеется не большая торговая точка, и там хочет производить мороженное на продажу. Абдусамат решил приобрести новый аппарат для производство мороженное. Это аппарат стоит дорого, по этой причине Абдусамат обратился за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему иметь желаемый аппарат и начать бизнес.
texts.en: Abdusamat is from the city of Istaravshan.  He is 41 years old and lives with his mother, wife, and two children.  He has one daughter and one son who were raised well and are now adults.  Abdusamat wants his children to be well-mannered and well-educated.  His wife is also a smart, hospitable woman, and works from home sewing women's clothing.  Abdusamat wants to start making ice cream.  Abdusamat has a small retail shop and there hopes to sell ice cream.  Abdusamat decided to purchase a new ice cream machine to make ice cream.  The machine is expensive, and for this reason Abdusamat is seeking a loan that will help him to buy the desired machine and start his business.

loans.use: to purchase an ice cream machine

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru: Элмурод ответственный и активный мастер. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Элмурод живет вместе с отцом, матерью, сестренкой, женой и детьми. Жена Элмурод занимается торговлей деятельности в магазине. Сам Элмурод освоил деятельность отца, и идет по его стопам. Он сейчас отремонтирует автомашин. Делает сварки, шпаклевки, грунтовка и краску. Все он делает сам, иногда ему помогает его отец. У Элмурод одна единственная сестренка. Она сейчас сильно болеет. Ей нужно сделать операцию и лечению. Для операции у них нет денежных средств, и Элмурот решил взять кредит для операции и купли лекарство.
texts.en: Elmurod is a responsible and active handyman.  He is 30 years old, married, and has children.  Elmurod lives together with his father, mother, younger sister, wife, and children.  Elmurod's wife works in retail at a store.  Elmurod himself has mastered his father's business, and is following in his footsteps.  He works repairing cars, and does welding, applies putty, and primes and paints.  He does everything himself, though his father occasionally helps him.  Elmurod has only one sister.  Right now she is very sick, and needs medicine and an operation.  The family doesn't have enough money to pay for the operation, and so Elmurod decided to ask for a loan for the operation and to buy medicine.

loans.use: to pay for his younger sister's operation and to purchase medicine
